text: So disappointed. Went to watch the free movie at 8pm, but then our kids wanted to explore the tree house/slides like after an hour. Kids are NOT allowed here after 9 nor can they explore the jungle gym! WTF! Kids not being allowed in the play area is a crime. You have to be 21 and up after 9. But in the summer, it's hot as balls, so we didnt even want to go there until the sun went down. That leave little to no time until 9! Also, it's smaller than I thought. Good for a few beers and a meal, but not for families. More shit in Vegas not for families.

A short walk from Fremont street. This would be a really cute little place to visit with kids as there is a tree house play area. 
Other than that, this place was smaller than expected,  the stores weren't too interesting, and none of the food was appealing.  
Cool concept, very creative though.
Cute boutique stores, but very pricey.  Go for the experience, not really the shopping.

Super fun place for a summer Sunday morning at 9:30am where it's already 97 degrees.  The water misters are on and we are the only family here.  There is one coffee shop open and the rest of the shops  open at 11am. Our 7 and 9 year olds are loving running all over the tree house. 

I love this place. Hats off (or should I say shoes off to Zappos!) to the creative thinkers, planners and idealists who made this place happen.

Geared towards locals but what a great spot for non-locals too. My 9 & 11 year olds played tag in the play area with new friends for an hour while i browsed the shops & watched them play. Fun, hip, design w/all the modern conveniences of being new. Very pleasant surprise.  Very food heavy & not all the shops were open on a Saturday at 2 pm - which seemed like prime time to me but maybe not? HIghly reccomend dropping in. After 9 pm it is 21 & over so go early with the kiddos.

Great place to hang out, especially if you have kids and are staying downtown. We were staying at the El Cortez and there isn't a pool. What we really wanted was just to hang out in the 70 degree weather (it was 30's and I e/snow in Montana).  Container park was just what we needed. No charge to get in, pretty cool shops to buy kids toys, candy etc, good restaurants, great praying mantis out front that spits fire in the evening, cool heart shaped art piece out front you can hook a lock on. Do it, it's a great break from Fremont st.
This was my 1st time here and I was pleased. This is a great place to shop, eat great food and it's also kid-friendly...I'll definitely be back!!!
I stopped by Pork and Beans at the Container Park and wow the food was awesome! I have been to New Orleans many times and I have found my new home for Cajun food in Vegas!!!!

I had an horrible experience today at the BBQ spot first of all the chick that was working the register had the worse customer service not professional at all and horrible attitude I ordered chicken Potatoe salad mac and cheese he ordered ribs mac and cheese Potatoe salad it was gross he bit into the rib which was cold horrible had a raw smell means not clean the Potatoe salad was super dry and mac and cheese awful my chicken boo boo!! We took a bite of everything and we both couldn't take another both meals totaled 20 something I told him I'm gonna get our money back he said no leave it we walked out left the food I would never ever go back WASTED MONEY

Easy walk from Fremont Street Experience. Escape the madness for a different type of fun. This is a fun little shopping/dining area. Each shop is a shipping container which means they are small and interesting. Several restaurant/bars with outdoor seating. Great kids areas.

Love the container park! Except recently, they refused to let in a male african american friend of mine wearing a BATHING SUIT. And a shirt. After letting in two women in swimsuits, with their tits hanging out. Bouncer said it was "his opinion" that parents would find it distasteful. What a double standard. I have spent nearly every weekend here at the park as a local and seen signs for no alcohol but no public sexist regulations on how patrons should dress. Very disappointed and sad to have to take my business elsewhere.

It's super cool how they put this together.  Recycling storage containers and turning them into an outdoor mall.  The playground looks like a good time, and I can't wait to come back and bring my kids so they can play.  The Beat has a small shop there as well, just to the left of the entrance, which was nice to see.  The best part is the giant praying mantis (or is it a grasshopper?) outside that spews fire!  Friggin cool.  You'll often find performers outside as well, just outside of the entrance.  That's fun.

Conceptually this place is great. We were there on the soft open and walking into the interior transports you to a different place.  It's pretty well planned space - although with the heat I can see the play structure becoming a problem in the summer.  A few more decent shops and I can see this place being very popular. I like the concept of having a few of them be pop-up shops although I agree with one of the other reviewers in that a few of the shops seem to be lacking in real products.

If you have kids and you are looking for a free park for your kids to enjoy hours of playtime, this is the place to be.  There's cute little shops to keep you occupied.  The only thing is that an adult has to be physically in the park.  You can't bring strollers in and you can't watch the kids from the tables and chairs right outside the park fence.  So if you have an infant and an older child, bring your carrier or baby car seat with you.

Such a great addition to DTLV.  We are not locals, but come to Vegas often.  We only stay downtown and love having this little gem to go to.  Weather our 10 year old is with us, or we are alone, it's a must do.  Before this was built I hated that you could not "sit" anywhere in the sun and enjoy an adult beverage.  I know other places have now popped up with outdoor seating, but in my book this is the best.  Grab a beer,wine,cocktail and a taco,BBQ,hotdog and enjoy the day! Also came on a movie night, we had a blast.

The shops close around 9PM but the restaurants and bars are open til later. Also, you can play on the playground when all the kids are gone! The praying mantis is really neat and the place has an overall sophisticated atmosphere.

If you're coming just for the park, keep an eye out for street parking. The ones with the meters aren't bad.. $1 per hour with 2 hours max. You don't have to pay if it's after 6PM.

It is very easy to spot the Container Park.. if the shipping containers stacked on top of each other doesn't give it away, the huge praying mantis sprouting fire from its antennae will. I noticed a few security guys at the entrance. One walked up to a lady that was smoking near the planters & kindly asked her to discard of it (not leave it on the ground) when she was finished. I thought it was semi random, but nice at the same time - to have a sense of security in the park. (& cleanliness!)  

My friends & I went through the park pretty quickly. It was a weekend when we went, so there was live music - always awesome! The treehouse in the playground looked super fun! I will have to check it out for myself one of these days. We went through all of the shops/boutiques featuring art, fashion, recycled vases and glasses, etc.. all of which are really unique. Even though there is tons of restaurants located in DTLV, there are a handful of places to get some small eats in the park.

The Container Park has a little bit of everything for everyone & is a great addition to Downtown Las Vegas! If you haven't been there already, go!
Love this park. Great for family outing and supporting local business. Enjoy the movie night and the community events. Great food and beverage too!!

Great hang out area with a great range of reasonably priced reaturants. We stopped at the Mexican shop & the hot dog shop.  The asada quesadilla was one of the best in my memory and the gringo tacos were spot on as well.  The gourmet hot dog shop had tons of unique choices for everyone.  The fire shooting praying mantis tops it all off!!

Really awesome concept.  Several industrial containers transformed into storefronts, restaurants, and bars with a jungle gym for the kids in the center of the park (before 9:00 p.m., that is) and a concert stage.

My friend suggested this place during a recent trip to Las Vegas and I'm so glad that we checked it out.  There's an eclectic mix of things, ranging from boutique clothes stores to small art galleries.  Apparently, the vendors were selected to participate (i.e., businesses couldn't just sign on), which I think is a smart way to ensure a good ratio of stuff to see and do.

I love that this place is in downtown (in fact, just a block or two from Fremont Street), but feels miles away from the casinos, gambling, and general Vegas debauchery.  I only wish that this existed when I lived in Las Vegas!
Cool local shops - much more interesting than the Fremont Street Experience.

We love staying on fremont street when we come to vegas, but the stores on fremont leave much to be diesired.  My husband and I discovered the container park. We just love it, being small business owners ourselves we liked that we were supporting small businesses. We also were able to grab perfect non Las Vegas gifts for our employees! Each gift we found here suited each person!  The shops prices were reasonable for unique items.  As a tourist I didn't think the area was shady at all.  I could possibly see someone from a rural area being a bit turned off, but being from a large urban area I know it's not that bad of an area.

My impression is that I am not nearly hipster or yuppy-vapid enough to truly appreciate this place, I guess. My husband really wanted to go here so I humored him and we did just that, luckily it was after 9pm on a Thursday so parking was easy enough to find and we didn't have to pay, but any other time I can see the HUGE draw back. 

There were the drunk pretentious Vegas/LA type people who are only their to drink and be seen. Most of the shops were closed, except for the food and beverage scene. Not impressed at all. Pricing like that of The Strip, which I guess means it is normally overrun with tourons. If I want that experience i'll go a few blocks over to Fremont or down to The Strip. 

NOT going back if I can help it.

My wife and I were in Vegas and had heard about the container park and had to check it out on our way to the mob museum.

All this is is a Multi level shopping center constructed of containers with very small local artists.  I thought it was more of an art display judging by the giant preying mantis in front but it was not.

Here's the thing, it is a great concept but I don't understand why it is so popular or such a big deal.  A few small bars, a few small shops and in Vegas everything is living large so no clue why this is so cool.  Maybe just because it's an escape from the ordinary?  Anyway, not worth driving from the strip and paying for parking as a tourist but maybe as a local I would check it out.
Always nice to stop by this interesting open-air market to grab a bite or a drink with friends. Relaxing and casual atmosphere, clean and welcoming place to chill out.

I didn't really care for it...Really overpriced, beer in a small plastic cup $8-10 bucks while having security watch you drink it...No thanks.  The only thing cool about it is the nice park in the center where the children can play.  The shops are nice however most of the art and goods being sold is really expensive.  It might work for a tourist hangout but too overcrowded and overpriced for locals.  Any review take as a grain of salt...Go see it for yourself.

We had a great stroll from Fremont Street Experience to the Container Park.  The shops were eclectic and very interesting.  We ate at a great taco shop, Pinches and enjoyed every bite!  Make sure to bring the kids and an appetite as the park family friendly during the day and has awesome restaurants. If you go to Pinches get the elite, it was awesome!
So neat down there... Can't wait to go back during the day and check out all the shopping...

My friends and I stumbled across this place, while walking the strip.   What a blessing!  An earth friendly park made out of containers, with a great concept trying to help "little business'.

This park has great potential to make it big, it is clean fun and it is kid friendly for those that are looking for that. 

We stopped and ate at Bin 45 ( I think that was the name!)  The appitizer plates were A-M-A-Z-I-N-G!   The owner was very sweet and has a great concept, decorated beautifully, good pricing, good wines, and most of all decent prices. 

I hope everyone from visitors to locals check this place out, it's worth it!

I enjoyed everything about Container Park. Being from Vancouver, BC, one of the things I hate about Vegas (and the USA in general) is the blatant lack of recycling. Container Park is built around the premise of reuse and recycle and had the ONLY recycling/compost stands I saw in 8 days of being in Vegas. The shops are nothing to write home about but we did enjoy some drinks from Oak & Ivy and some BBQ from Big Ern's BBQ. Those stops were highlights and it was really nice to get out of the Vegas bustle and be somewhere relatively quiet and enjoy the sunshine. At sundown there's a ceremony to wake up the Preying Mantis out front, complete with flame throwers. You should read the plaque at the Mantis on the how and why it was built (It's still a functioning vehicle!) because it's pretty awesome. 

We hit up the Fremont Street Experience afterwards and within the timeframe of our stay in Vegas, we wanted to go back to Container Park for more sunshine and drinks but never made it. If you want somewhere on the quieter side of Vegas, go here.

Amazing place for kids and hipsters.  The surrounding area is very hip.  Great food and pubs.  Inside the container park, is one of the best kid play areas around.  My kids love coming here.  This is a place for locals and tourist.  Got to check it out.

This place is really cool! I walked around with my friend and checked out the little boutiques and eateries. I even noticed a Vegan restaurant and while I'm not vegan I thought it was really cool that options were available. I feel like this place would be really attractive to young people, especially if there was live music playing. 
     My friend and I sat on a little roof terrace over looking the entrance and between the nice weather and soft variation of music (from hits to French jazz to adult contemporary) we were able to concentrate and actually get some studying done. This is a great place to hang out with friends, enjoy the weather, or even experience a first date. I will definitely be back and I can't wait to experience the different things this place has to offer!

Love me some Container Park. I go with the kids who burn off the tacos and cupcakes in the park area. I go with adults and grab a drink from Bin 702 (who introduced me to Stella Artois Cidre) and just relax on the patio. It can get crowded, but that's better than the alternative. The live music is great, food is fantastic and I've done a good amount of shopping in their stores all in the name of supporting local businesses. It's ALL good. Any negative comments are totally unwarranted. Like parking . . . You're Downtown - parking isn't supposed to readily available. Have you ever been to a city before? How about parking a few blocks away and walking a bit? If you fear for your life, I'm sure a Downtown Ranger can escort you. If you fear for your car, park it in a casino garage. Not many developers would have speculated on a project of this magnitude.  Las Vegas owes Tony Hsieh a huge thank you for this investment and the hundreds of thousands of repeat visitors and new residents to the area would agree.

Beyond disappointed with this small block of nothing really. Took the kids hoping to spend a few hours shopping and letting the kids play on the playground. Half of the slides on the playground where closed. Kids spent maybe 10 minutes on the playground and left disappointed. Shops where a joke. One star for the overall feel and sad one little block of shops...5 stars for the Jerky store that was great! Very personable guy working there gave us samples of anything we wanted to try. Bought a couple bags of jerky. Spent about 30 minutes total down here as it was very small and disappointing.

This is a great place to take your kids. It is nice, clean, and family friendly. There's a cool playground area but keep in mind, kids are not allowed to be in the park after a certain time. There's a couple of small bars with overpriced drinks as you are not allowed to bring your own drinks into the park. I checked out the cute shops but nothing was really special to me. Most of the shops were deserted. There is a stage with a live band playing on some nights.This is a nice place but it isn't a must see if you are a tourist. I think you would be disappointed unless you have a lot of free time.

What an epic FAIL!!! At 8:00pm they close the park to 21 and over only because they do not want under age drinking. But they serve alcohol all day when all the kids are here. What idiots!!! So of course now at 9pm its dead.

The Container Park is fairly new attraction to downtown Las Vegas.  It is definately a prime example of recycling.  All the shops and food/drink outlets are build using storage containers, even the elevator shafts are inverted containers. Indeed I said elevators, which makes getting up to the 2nd & 3rd floors for people not capable of climbing stairs and missing out visiting these upper level shops.

This is truly a place that you can visit many times as there are various food outlets to sample with shops and boutiques to brouse or purchase quality products.

Don't miss out on this adventure.

The container park is the absolute best place to shop in Las Vegas. The stores are amazing, The prices can not be beat. Also there is an amazing park for children to play. There are many great small family owned businesses and unique commodities you will not find anywhere else. You can also grab a drink or a nice vegan lunch. can you really beat that? check it out...seriously...go there...

I have to give some credit to those who risk investing money into Downtown. If we all keep saying that Downtown is cool, maybe someday it will be.  

The Trailer Park is an interesting idea but there are some fundamental problems. The stores with their tinted windows and small doors, are not inviting to come in. It was not a very "invite to shop" environment. I have big concerns on whether many shops will make it. I don't have any idea how much rent is but the small square footage of the stores will certainly mean that they won't be able to make enough to stay afloat.

From a social "place to hang out, t Trailer Park is going to be a smash hit. Bars will do great when it warms back up.  It will be a wonderful place for Downtowners to hang out and just ,,, yknow,,, hang out and have conversations about how cool downtown is.

I wish the place best of luck, fix accessibility to the shops and you are up to 4 stars.

Interesting concept. Great scenery. Chill vibe. Awesome treehouse. Will be going back.

Came here on a Friday night in the summer.

It's very neat to see what the designers were capable of doing with just your average shipping container. Each of the stores, restaurants, and bars had great facades that did not make them look as though it was a container, until you stepped inside. However, even than they were all so well put together you forgot you were even in a shipping container!

We watched three bands play live on the stage.  The music was good, it had us entertained throughout each of the performances (roughly 30 min each).  The grass area right in front was perfect because you got the draft from the fans/misters in each of the four corners of the lawn.  Grab some legos and those blue cushions and build yourself a chair/couch and enjoy the music!

The vibe was very laid back.  There were no kids when we went, all adults.  Everyone was just there to relax and enjoy the music and scenery. They have plenty of chairs, couches, tables etc. for decent sized groups.

I highly recommend the treehouse (yes even if you're an adult) because you can never be too old to go down an awesome slide! Lots of fun!

Overall, good time. Will definitely be going back again in the future!

The most annoying praying mantis old ass burning man shit ever made !! You people think it's cool with your dumb ass kids .. Live down here it's the most annoying shit ever , song selection is horrible and the dudes can't even keep time with it . Hate it !!! Biggest waste of money
We went and the kids place is pretty awesome---check out the built-in scavenger hunt in this video - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Q10OUk_8MDI

I read about The Container Park in a business magazine so I had to check it out for myself on a recent trip to Vegas. This place is so cool. Great dining options, fun local merchants, live music, and a 20 foot tall mantis sculpture that shoots fire out the top. Great atmosphere inside and very family friendly. I ate at Big Ern's. Great ribs at reasonable prices. Go check it out...it's a great departure from the standard Vegas glitz.

My family loves this park! The tree house is so much fun and the playground is perfect for all ages! They have cute boutiques, great food and later in the evening is 21 and older with a band... Love it!

If you're on a trip to Vegas I would recommend spending some time downtown and I would check out the Container Park.

First thing I noticed on my visit was the giant mantis outside that was breathing fire!! Pretty impressive! Also as it was close to Halloween they had the place decked out with pumpkins, scarecrows and cute photo-op areas.

I felt safe walking into the area as they had security that welcomed me. I was there on a midweek evening; it wasn't busy but there were still people about. 

There are lots of cute little food places, stores and a play park in the middle for kids.  If your visiting the Freemont Street experience its just a short walk from the end of that.

If I am back in Vegas I will make sure to visit when I have more time to see more!

Came here tonight and thought it was interesting! The place has something to do for all ages, including a little playground in the middle. There was even a mantis at the entrance that had flames coming out of its antennas (we called it the Flaming Mantis). I was a little surprised with how small the place was, and was even more surprised that the shops were closed. Having lived here in Vegas for 13 years, I've gotten used to stores/shops closing at 9 or 10 at night, but we came here around 8:30 and a majority of the stores were closed. The only ones open were the eating places, including this jerky place (Jo Jo's Jerky) that was super awesome! The jerky sold at that store is very tasty, full of flavor, and will definitely leave you hungry for more. 1 bag of jerky is $8, which was a little steep but the jerky was delicious. Definitely recommend visiting this place!

This place is a hidden gem!!  It's as child's and adults playground !!!  

 They have everything good wise bars shopping adult size slides!!! 

 And from 9-11pm its 21 and up AMAZING! !!!

We just moved here my family and I from Philadelphia. Container park was visited by random coincidence on one of our first trips downtown. Once I was inside, it was quickly by far the most attractive, family friendly place I have been to so far in Las Vegas. I have 3 children and a husband and this park has everything for everyone. There were lots of bars and shops for me and my husband to look around in  while the kids play and for the very little ones we took them with us. Everything was family-friendly, the food is pretty good I especially like the perch. I encourage anyone to make a visit.

The Black Cup in the "Container Park"  is new.  Unfortunately their espresso was down and we all weren't able to get anything.  My grandson & I got iced coffee with a flavor.  It was rich coffee & fantastic in the heat!  

Joselyn assisted us & was really accommodating; she was not the owner.  It always impresses me when the employees are as accommodating as Joselyn because you just don't see that! Her customer service was over the top; THANKS!

Thought the area had a nice "bent" for children.  Vegas, however, does need a LOT more; a large amount of people living in the area are now families...not just those in Vegas for the shows or gambling.
We enjoy hanging out here. The kids get to play in the playground that's nice and clean. Cute little shops and the kids always enjoy the candy shop.

WE SAW FIRE!"
We were walking down Fremont street and saw bursts of fire lighting up the sky! Kept walking towards it and found the Container Park. I do alot of research before we goto Las Vegas every year. This was a great spot that we fell into. Nice local shops and owner operated spaces. This is a must stop to get away from the noise of downtown

We had such a good time here today!! I'm so thrilled to see downtown Vegas getting cleaned up and all the new places popping up. My kids had so much fun playing in the "treehouse" playground and playing in front of the stage while listening to live music. We had lunch at Pinches Tacos (YUM), and bought some candy from the candy shop. There were lots of shops and such I wanted to look through, but we will save that for another time.  I can't wait to come back here again! Day or night, Container Park is a lot of fun for all ages.

Without a doubt the coolest thing in the downtown area! 

At night, this place becomes adults only and holy hell is it cool. 

Three story playground with a giant slide. 

Giant building blocks. 

Giant Lego blocks! 

Cool ninja game!!

Gigantic metal preying mantis that does a regular pyro show to sweet music!!!

All this and some really cool shops! Without a doubt, The best hidden gem of the downtown area

5 stars for effort and creativity, 3 stars for quality of stores.

Now, before everyone comes at me with pitchforks for not giving 5 stars, lemme finish.

I LOVE the concept.  It's green, provides a community space for downtown, and offers some non-chain stores to the local population (and there are no nail salons, thank the spaghetti monster).

But, honestly, I question the longevity of some of these stores.  There were a ridiculous amount of fashion jewelry stores in the park.  And, many of them were of the quality of a subpar Etsy store.  Sorry, not sorry.

However, I'm sure the best will survive and we'll lose the rest.  Until then, 4 stars.
Fantastic unique stores and restaurants that make you feel like you're somewhere other than Vegas.... which if you're like us, is just what you're looking for when you're in Vegas.

I like what they're trying to do here, and because it's in such a sketchy area I understand why strong security has to be in place, but the security guards here are such d*cks, after a couple of tries, I'd never come here again.  Each time we entered, we were scolded for something: no dogs, no water bottle, no small cup of coke my friend was carrying...and in a ridiculous "respect-my-authority" kind of way.  At least a smile and a "welcome" to go along with your admonishment if you're gonna be that strict.  And how is not allowing someone to walk in with a 12 oz cup of coke gonna keep your criminal element out anyway...?  So in short, the bars and restaurants inside, while cute, are not worth the abuse to get in.  Or maybe they are, but I'll never know...

My sister lives in Las Vegas and every time I come visit from Michigan we have to make a stop at Container Park. This morning we picked up donuts and enjoyed them on the swing in the shade. The cooling fans make this a comfortable place to hang out, and the music adds a fun atmosphere. 
I enjoy it at night, too. They have a lot of cute shops and restaurants. Even adults can enjoy the play structures and activities!
Make sure to see the praying mantis outside light up at night. 
Come enjoy the atmosphere any time of day - you won't be disappointed!

The Container Park is exactly what was needed to bring people down to a part of town that we may otherwise never frequent. Brought my daughters here this morning and the whole day was a blast. Parking is free on Sundays and we got here early enough that there were plenty of spots close by. The focal point of the park is the playground. It's 100 times better than what they offer at Town Square. It's also managed very well. There were at least three guards (all of them super friendly) manning the area, two at the gate and one next to the giant slide, which they managed to very organized despite the number of kids running around. There is a grassy area with toys and balls for the kids to enjoy while a live band plays some chill music. The park, and the people in it, remind me a lot of 3rd St Promenade in Santa Monica.  We had lunch at the BBQ joint. Delicious! We walked around the bins (shops), but unfortunately, the only ones we bought anything in was the candy shop. I do hope the stores do well but I predict not so much. But back to the candy shop...I asked my kids, multiple times, to stop manhandling the candy (it was wrapped) and the gentleman who worked there actually encouraged them to go for it--"what else should kids do in a candy store?," he said. That was just awesome!! Kind of sums up the attitude of everyone at the park. Loved it and will be back. A lot!
awesome! wish i'd gone here earlier: local stuff, trinkets, awesome things galore!
Fun place for kids and adults and they have a vegan food spot which is great. Staff is friendly. We had fun

I recently found out about container park and after visiting I just won't stop going. Love how eco friendly everything here is!! If only the entire city could be this way now haha. But the have delicious vegan food and even vegan jerky there! Beautiful art work and a neat playground for kids

This was a cool scene! Especially nice since I had one friend who needed to eat something kind of special (so the vegan place was perfect, and the kale chips were on point) and her husband wanted Mexican breakfast and I wanted something to drink and something sweet so we were able to just scope out the whole place and then all eat together outside. Got some interesting candy from the candy shop, got a tasty hot cocoa from the popsicle shop, got anequally tasty blood orange margarita at the taaco shop. AND the kids were all very well contained in the play area and NOT running around getting in my way! There was a beef jerky store with free samples! It was like all the good stuff about a good truck park (variety!) but you don't have to shout up into a little window awkwardly and there's little shops, to boot.
Told me they was lamas here but there is just good food and drinks and tourists. No lamas. Not even fake ones.

What a great find in downtown Las Vegas! Such a great concept to use shipping containers for the little shopping center! Such a cute place and it has a great feeling when you are there! My children loved playing there and going on the twisty slides. They also loved the toy store which has something for everyone!

I live in Vegas and hate going downtown but I will go f it involves the container park. My husband and I love that we can go here, enjoy some good food, have a drink and let our daughter have a great time playing. The kids treehouse is great for the kids and, as a parent, I love that it is secure. There is one entrance and exit which is manned by a park employee. Some of the employees are more attentive then others, but I don't expect them to be watching my child. We always bring friends and family here while they are visiting from out of town and are never disappointed. It is always clean and, unlike the strip or Fremont, there are no homeless and/or panhandlers.  It can get expensive though as it's easy to keep buying food/drinks. Overall, it is one of the bright spots downtown and can be enjoyed with kids.

I checked out the Container Park for the first time today and I liked it! Today was an especially nice day, which made it nice to sit in one of the many outdoor places and enjoy it's wonderful, hip atmosphere with music. It's very family-friendly with two play areas for kids (and adults) with cute shops and restaurants. The concept is great and a wonderful way to support small businesses by providing affordable places small businesses in shipping bins. It's also a way to modernize the downtown area, which is desperately needed. I loved how some of the eateries (maybe two of them) had areas on their rooftops where you can eat and drink. What a cool idea! The downside is that it's not a huge development, so there wasn't a large variety of shops. I didn't really see anything that I would buy, and the majority of the shops focused on food, which was very pricey! However, it's still a great idea to have a place like that!

It's just a couple of blocks away from the Fremont St Experience in downtown Vegas. I went there on a Monday afternoon.  The place was dead.  The park is really a small shopping center with a park in the middle. There's playground and a stage.  The only busy store was Cheffini's hot dogs.

The unique aspect of this place is the shopping center is made from shipping containers. I tried to take some pictures, but the guard said I wasn't allowed to take pictures.  The last location where they told me I couldn't take picture was because they were currently in a lawsuit. The shopping center is on the corner with entrances on each side, but they have one side locked up with a guard on the other entrance. The area seemed safe, but now I'm wondering how safe.

The brainchild of Zappos' CEO Tony Hsieh, this lovely little mini shopping park was a nice break from our degenerate gambling habits.

No doubt are the businesses, as well as the restrooms are ecologically made from recycled shipping containers. The businesses all operate out of the modular metal squares instead of the traditional brick-and-mortar spaces.

There are a handful of stores selling anything from jerky, art decor, bath and home goods, toys, and restaurants slinging tacos 'Made by real Mexicans - as their slogan advertises', a BBQ joint, and candies.

The center of the park contain a giant tree house, a playground and there is even a sitting area with a stage and projection screen for perhaps late night movies.

It's not too far of a walk from the Fremont Experience. Just look for the giant praying mantis (it breathes fire at night!) at the entrance.
Pretty interesting place, would be nice for some casual dating spot.  It has a lot of different shops to visit and see.

The Container Park is nothing like anything I have ever seen. The concept of building stores out of shipping containers mixed with the vibrant colors, elaborate children's playground, and stage with a lawn make for a great combination. 

If I have extra time downtown, this is always where I hang out, especially at night. If I had kids, this is definitely a spot I would take them. It almost feels like a little urban oasis. 

My issue with the Container Park is the number of stores, the store hours, and the price ranges of the stores. While each store seems to be very unique, there do not seem to be enough stores. You can easily blow through them all in twenty minutes. The stores also close before the park, so if you come at night, don't expect to be browsing for anything. The stores also seem to have very high prices. Even the candy, ice cream, and food are overpriced. 

The first time I came here, I made a special trip for it, but that was a bit of a mistake. I should have waited until I was in the area with more things to do.

I just had to review this place! Lately my Yelp account has been taken over with too many negative stars. As an European/Californian transplant to L.V. I am absolutely over the moon for this place. It feels like home. Although some of the stores are lacking, the energy makes up for it, as does the super cool grass and park area! As a hip. 20 something mom I had a lot of fun. I want all of the town to evolve into this! Let's revolutionize. It's time.

Such a fun place for the family. Have the kids do the passport stamps, they will get a lot of free goodies. I've brought my family here twice and I have a 4 year old, 11 year old, and 14 year old and each one enjoys it. I haven't tried the food yet so I can't rate that. I'm looking forward to coming for date night with my husband because after 9 pm it's 21 and over.

Eh, this place is... okay. I think it's definitely worth checking out once or twice, but I wasn't entirely that impressed. It's much smaller than I anticipated, especially the shops. The shipping containers are a cool concept, but I didn't really care for the stores inside. I don't have kids, so maybe I should've visited in the evening when the bars open up and it becomes 21+. 

I do think the container park has had a huge hand in the revitalization of Fremont, though. And, it's kind of cool to start at the container park and stroll west on Fremont afterward. I haven't been to old Vegas in years and years, so it was a pleasant surprise. 

Anyway, I say, if you're looking for something quick to do, check this place out, but you probably won't make a full day of it.

Came to the Downtown Container Park on a Sunday night and it was pretty dead -- and smaller than I thought it would be. The "container" aspect of this isn't as central as the name and pictures make it out to be. The "park" is really a small outdoor mall enclosure. The retail spaces and food options didn't look that exciting.

I'm giving the Downtown Container Park 3 stars solely for the giant praying mantis out front (7th & Fremont)! It has flames coming out of its antennae. As if that isn't awesome enough, periodically the flames shoot even higher/bigger in time to music. Ridiculously cool. I don't think this happens on a schedule per se (wasn't on the hour when we were there), so hope for good timing when you are wandering by! 

In any case, the praying mantis is outside the Container Park, so there isn't really any need to go inside in my opinion unless you were already planning on going to one of the bars/restaurants. Better to just check out the praying mantis as you're either going to or leaving the main Fremont area.
Really cool place!! You need to check it out! Great place to take kids, as there is a park and cool stuff to see.

I love the atmosphere of Container Park. The family friendly energy is very inviting and the after-dark adult hours is a great weekend date spot or hangout. The businesses are unique and don't pressure you to buy. Can't forget the live entertainment is always welcomed!
well worth a visit. bought a few things and had some luch. A great break from trawling Freemont. Don't tell anyone though.

This is a great Las Vegas attraction. Basically a bunch of small businesses located in shipping containers. Mostly stores but a couple of restaurants and even two bars. There is also a playground area for kids and a stage for shows. It is easy to find with the giant flaming praying mantis out front. Definitely check out Oak & Ivy while there.

So there's something new Downtown.

There's more to it than bars. 

It's Town Square-ish, but the difference is it's almost entirely composed of locally-owned businesses. Hooray.

There's stuff for kids (a giant park in the middle for them to run around).

It would be a GREAT hangout spot in the summer, I'm willing to bet.

The only pitfall is the restaurants were a tad pricey (can't remember the name but the Taqueria joint had to be one of the most expensive taquerias I have ever seen).

Otherwise, I'll be back.

We went to the website to see store hours. We cruised 1 hours around the block to get through the festival and find parking. And then we found out that the mall was closed respectively inside the festival. Why no information about this on the website?

Wow.
Downtown Las Vegas is really starting to come around.
Took a quick little walk though this place.
Such a cool use for old ship containers. Stacked about 3 stories high and filled with shops and restaurants. Big playground in the middle for the kids. 
There was a big stage and grass area to check out live music.
Poked my head into Jojo's  Jerky. The girl behind the counter was kind enough to let us try a bunch of samples. Ended up buying the Curry Jerky, which was pretty darn good.
I expect to come by next time I'm in town in a couple months.
Great place for kids and families. I gave 4 stars for allowing smoking. They have lots of local restaurants as well. Parking is a bit of a walk.

I really enjoyed myself in this place. Looking at it from the outside you would not think it is as nice as it is in the inside but I must say that I was very impressed. I did not think that a glass of wine served at Boozer bar (I think it was called) was worth the $12 when the restaurant at the edge of the container park before you walk out was serving the same glass of wine for $5 so I took away a star for that. It was just highway robbery for that cheap wine and if it is sold for $5 at a different restaurant in container park then it should be sold for the same price there as well. It wasn't a fancy bottle for a plastic cup worth $12. 

Anyways, the park itself was amazing! Play ground for kids, people laughing and loving their time. Food everywhere, coffee, ice cream. Perfect spot for a family. I will go to this place over and over again. My second day was in the daylight and I thought it was amazing. Especially after my initial impression from the outside. Walking in was like night and day.

Check this place out because you're going to love it!

We went there during the day with kids so I can't comment on the adult scene.  As far as kids parks go this place was very disappointing.  Pretty much everything was broken.  Every single slide was closed.  It was a bummer to make a trip to come to this place and have your kids ready to leave after 5 minutes.  Kids were pretty rowdy there so I am sure this is difficult to maintain.  Good concept though.

They do have security there but it seemed like their primary concern was making sure that parents weren't just leaving their kids there.  With all of the casinos steps away some people probably do try to use this place as free babysitting.

I'd heard the hype from friends and expected more.  But I went during the day with my husband and no kids. That was a mistake.  There was good music but at 100 degrees who wants to sit outside surround by metal and listen? 

We shopped, but three shops were closed on a Saturday afternoon.  The BBQ we ate was very nice and the chocolate shop is fantastic.  All the employees everywhere were very friendly and helpful. But after lunch, we were done in under 30 minutes.

To be fair, I think it would be a very different experience at night.

I am so excited that The Downtown Project has brought this park to Fremont East!!!  Container Park is filled with boutique shops including art, jewelry, gifts, unique clothing, food, fun, and drinks.  The area is relatively small and compact, making it easy to visit every shop in one day if you like and it is built for all ages to enjoy.
A playground fills the center of this roughly-oval shaped space, where greeters even let us big kids go down the 4-story spiraling  slide.   Speaking of greeters, DTP has employed a multitude of people focused on ensuring that you are enjoying Container Park.  
While sipping on a brew at Bin 702 (local Joseph James Brewery's 'Red Fox'), Eric cruised by for a happiness check.  These greeters are such a fantastic idea!  Not only do they add a sense of security, but their genuine nature and enthusiasm about downtown just make ya smile.
I have visited Container Park twice and look forward to making myself a regular there.
Pros: (so far) -Pinche Tacos---so authentic and vegetarian options for me!
                        -The Boozery       it's simple, they serve booze.  I likey.
                        -Bin 702  --exceptional beer list and great wines too.  
                                            I will be back to try the cheese plate
                        -The main stage which provides constant entertainment.
Cons:   The barstools at the Boozery are metal, the doors are open, and it is cold outside!  my cold bum cut my visit to this spot short.
              I know it might sound crazy to omnivores, but I would love to see some veggie options at the BBQ joint.  Get creative!
What's up with the Preying Mantis?
Very fun. Kids loved it, and there was plenty going on to keep occupied and entertained. This is a must see, especially if you have children.

So much to offer our ol' downtown Las Vegas.  An upgrade definitely to our downtown.  Jeff C. first introduced me to this family-friendly spot with many awesome unique art work, such as the 'Preying Mantis' fire shooter in front!  I love the art and overall the whole park is art.

The open area of retail stores, restaurants and bars are similar to Town Square, where you can walk outdoors to each place.  It's smaller and each unit is in a postal kind of shipping container (Hence Container Park).  Very colorful!  

In the front is a walk-thru coffee spot and on the right, further up, is a walk-up beer and BBQ spot.  On the left is a 'Tree House' which is pretty cool!  Stores are in between and there are two stages, in the front, and towards the back.  Also there are large foam 'Legos' to build with.  

Today was windy and I'd have to say the containers did a good job of blocking the wind.

This place is a lot of fun for the family. The tree house jungle gym at the center is very unique. The open grass area is a nice place to plop down and enjoy music. There also seem to be a lot of good eats, drink and fun artsy little shops. Great break from the hustle and bustle of Vegas. Must check out the toy store. They carry some cool toys.

Weak AF. It's a glorified strip mall, but it's made of shipping containers instead of stucco. My family visited a year ago and raved about it. When I finally got to go for myself, I was completely underwhelmed. You can buy knick-knacks and trinkets like at any strip mall, except they have a couple bars thrown in as well. Wow. 

If you have small kids, they'll love the treehouse and play area. If you like shopping, you'll enjoy it too. However, I wouldn't drive through the hood just to get here. It's not that special.
Such a great addition to the new emergence of the Urban DTLV vibe LOVE PLEASE MORE!!! Boutiques, food, bar, playground for kids,blowdry bar, barber, live music, super chill. All inside a gated park

WOW what an amazing, fun place! Lots of people watching & young children. They have a nice little play area for kids to run around in but they have to be supervised @ all times. Lots of cute shops & a few food places! Popcorn & candy store! Very close to Fremont street you can walk here. No cost to get inside. They have a security guard who walks around & keeps an eye on things. I came down during the day but know its opened during the night time.

We love coming here!!!  This place is Kids Friendly! Plenty of Restaurants to choose from and you can do some shopping if you'd like .  Tree house is my sons favorite !!!   Whoever invented this, I just want to say THANK YOU FOR BUILDING THIS PLACE! It's an awesome Place for kids :)

Knowing some behind the scenes stories this place really turned out to be a marvelous place of creative craftsmanship. 

Besides the famous praying mantis out front , it really makes a great photo op shot especially when the sun is setting. The glow of the sign, the angles of the buildings...very nice.

I could elaborate on on the shops but I will save each for there respected reviews. 

Uncle Tony was there shopping when we ran into him. We said hi and immediately made sure to lead us directly to the slide. Hubby, our friend and I were then led to the entrance. He explained that we HAD to go down the slide immediately so we did :) the slide did not let us down. Well technically it did. Climbing to the top...getting excited...having the green light and the sound.......ok you just have to go down the slide yourself.  

Container Park is a wonderful, family friendly, safe, fun, environment of positive Downtown vibe. 

The amazing shops, the children's area, good food, stage area, nice bars, flowing layout, are all impressive, and best of all DIFFERENT. 

CP is a playground for all.

Just a few blocks from Fremont Street Experience.

A great shopping area with shops and restaurants built with shipping containers. There is a kids playground in the middle of the park where kids can play so it's ideal for families. It is a nice place to visit and hang out. Not crowded as some of the tourists spots in Vegas.

WOW, this is a stupid place with idiots access staff.

We were a group of 6. Everyone over 21! More specifically: We are over 30 and 40 :)

- No access without age verification with ID Check.
- You must show you ID or you can't go into this area! Alcohol control for peoples over 30 and 40. Haha.

But they serve alcohol all day when all the children's are here (before the evening)!!

Great rules Container Park!!!!


Proposal:
Put up a sign,"We don't like customers"

Great place to shop, browse or just chill out and get away from the madness. Most of the structure is made from refurbished cargo containers, and looks pretty cool. A few interesting shops and places to grab food. Plus there's a kids playground in the middle.

It's cool to be able to play like a kid in an adult playground (late at night when is adults only). Sucks you can't bring drinks from outside in, I know it's too help the bars inside but there is nothing ever really happening to make us stay longer than 10-15 minutes. Gets boring quick. Need a daily night life activity, a weekly party? Come on! Open mic night? Community karaoke? Seriously get creative!

I live in downtown Las Vegas and my 5 year old daughter loves this park. It's clean, well maintained, safe and has great activities for kids. I really wish that they would even make it more kid friendly and get rid of some of the useless Knick-knack stores. It's very hard to combine a kid play area with bars and restaurants. I suggest having every store/restaurant inside being kid related.

This is a really phenomenal feat and is a great testament to architecture, art and ingenuity.  What a truly wonderful way to repurpose containers and make an amazing social meeting place with food, music, shopping and play areas for children!  Security and staff were amazing and it is a fabulous place to hang out, sight see or listen to some great live music or dj and people watch w a drink and/or some great food!
Me and my son has fun time there. The tree house playground was fun. You can get a drink and sit outside watching your kids playing. Nice clean place to visit beside casinos.

This is a pretty cool spot in Downtown Las Vegas.  It is built out of shipping containers and there are a lot of small boutique shops that rent the space.  Definitely worth checking out if you are in the area.

This place was ok to see once, during daylight hours.  Lots of vacant containers.  I would not suggest being near this block or Freemont Street when the sun sets.  There was another shooting 9 hours after leaving the vicinity.  https://www.reviewjournal.com/crime/shootings/police-looking-for-suspect-in-downtown-las-vegas-shooting/

THIS IS MY NEW FAVORITE HANG-OUT!!

My son loved it and I'm sure we'll be back for more. The place is perfect. It has a lot of various shops and boutique as well as food and bars for happy hour.

The center has a big playground and I love that they have "downtown rangers" that watches the kids and guides them. There's a part of the playground that is not accessible for younger kids (height restriction) due to safety and they strictly enforce that. 

I also love that they have those "mist sprays" to cool off during summer time. And adequate drinking stations! The bathrooms are also clean. 

I honestly can't find anything to complain about in this place!!! LOVE IT!!!

Container park is a short (and safe, lit) walk off the Fremont experience. It is an enclosed shopping-dining-drinking play area made of... Metal shipping containers. 

When we walked up, it was just after 9pm and our IDs were checked because after 9pm it's 21+. Our first impression included us geeking out at how cool it was that everything was made out of metal shipping containers. It was art! We were also kind of tipsy, so of course we went straight to the playground to hobble up it and ride the tube slides. That was super fun. They felt fast. They might not have actually been that fast. 

There was also a game where you have to run around and touch lights when they light up and try to beat your friends scores. That was even funnier after a couple more drinks. 

Grown up building blocks and gigantic Legos, lounges to chill, and lots of shopping and dining pleased us. Be aware that you cannot bring outside drinks in, so try to finish what your beverages on Fremont before you head that way. 

Container park and it's fire blowing preying mantis certainly was one of the highlights of our trip. At one point batman walked by and the praying mantis whispered "I am batman" and blew it's fire in the air. Batman shook his head and flipped his cape. Whatever, mantis. Blow your fire at someone else. 

You won't regret visiting here, especially if you're a bit inebriated.

Very new, very clean, lots of security for the tourist types, but fun for locals too. A great treehouse thing in the center to play on (And it's the only place in the park that will allow llamas, so if you bring your llama, be warned!).  Not all the containers are full, but there are lots of little galleries, artcraft stores, things to eat. Pair with other stops to fill out a night, this isn't enough on its own. After 9p, it is an over 21 only.

Okay if you've been in Vegas and haven't been do yourself a solid and go to this place. 
Good for day or night and they have a great space for kids to play. I wanted to play on the stuff for the kids haha. 
So this place was a nice surprise one night when I was taking a break from the casinos. It was night when I went the first time and immediately impressed with this cool place. Basically they took shipping containers and made them into businesses and places to eat and drink. From one level to 3 levels stacked high. They are all facing in to make like a big courtyard in the middle of them all with a big stage at one end and an amazing play area in the middle for kids. This center area has towers made out of ... you guessed it, containers stacked on end vertically with lookouts, bridges in between them and slides coming out too! 
Okay I could go on but I'll just say this place made me happy so go and have fun!!!!

Went to go try some BBQ at a new place. Was accosted by children acting as security guards demanding ID outside the place, despite the fact that I am clearly over 30 and was not buying alcohol. Left my driver's license in the car and was refused admission. The kid working the gate, who looked to be about 14 was clearly on a power trip, and denying me entrance seemed to make his night. If they so clearly lack any judgment whatsoever when it comes to letting people in, I can't imagine that they would have any when it comes to anything else. It's stupid enough that they are demanding ID in the first place, but his smarmy attitude and total power trip convinced me that this place wasn't worth walking to my car and back to get ID. Will not return. They could learn a thing or two about customer service.

A flaming preying mantis guards the Downtown Container Park, which is exactly what it sounds like: a playground park surrounded by stacked shipping containers housing a group of unique boutiques, shops, and restaurants you can't find elsewhere in the city.

Food options include barbeque at Ern's, frozen treats and sweets at Sasa and SweetSpot, and gourmet twists on hotdogs, tacos, and popcorn. Most boutiques are geared toward women's fashion accessories, but there is also a toy store, a Disney art store, and a general store. 

Plenty of stores to explore, a playground for kids during the day and adults at night, and alcoholic beverages available around every corner and in every form, from draft beers at the hotdog stand to frozen spiked pops at the popsicle place.
Worth a visit, lots of nooks to explore, a stage set up for live music, and free parking on Sundays.

So instantly felt like I walked into a trendy little park in downtown Portland, Oregon. The sounds of the live musician set a vibe throughout area as the smells of the BBQ restaurant tickled my tummy. 

6 of my kids went into the gated play park that has only one entrance and is watched by security. So kids can go in and parents have to check them out, which is awesome as I have a special needs daughter and she loves exploring. 

I want to commend the security and the manager, Julie as she intervened where a situation could have gone bad as an unknown lady attempted to take my 8 year old, non verbal daughter until my 4 year old son spoke out. Kudos to you Julie and your Security team. 

We will be back with and without the kids as this place just went to the top of me and my wife's date night list.

We came here for an afternoon get away to let the kids run around and grab some food/beverage all in one fell swoop. Little did we know what an incredible spot we were being introduced to!

After parking across the street, we were greeted by the sweet serenade of a cover band singing 90's hits - Win #1. At the entrance, we were further greeted by a 40 foot metal praying mantis that we would later find out spit fire from it's antennae - Win #2! Upon entering, we were filled with joy (as were the kids) by the gigantic metal play structure that rivaled the Ewok's tree world in Return of the Jedi  - Win #3!

Seriously though, this place was amazing. Two and three stories of shipping containers line the place and contain everything from solid restaurants (Bin 702 was incredible!) to a wedding chapel upstairs. The play land was incredible and had some security folks who wouldn't let kids in or out without a parent or older child being around. It was a well run ship!

Around 5 pm the mantis started shooting fire from it's head every 15 minutes and made for quite the show that both, 1) Was awesome and 2) Scared many of the kids. Though ours wanted to touch it, thus allaying any fears that remained.

Every city needs a place like this to encourage small businesses, the arts and interaction! Well done Las Vegas!
This place is cool and different. Everything is situated inside freight containers, stores and restaurants.  I like the fact they recycled materials to make something new.

Have heard much about the DCP but until today have not have a chance to visit. When we saw an event that supported small businesses within the park, we made it a point to visit. The GF and I rolled in via Uber and were dropped off at the praying mantis.  We stopped by the yelp desk and I was tickled pink to finally meet Norm K. & Nate M.  After exchanging pleasantries the GF and I were off to explore.

It is absolutely what one can do now a days with a freaking storage container.  I had marveled at the miscellaneous websites I have visited looking at cabin designs using with prefab material.  DCP is no exception. I likened it to a circular, multi-layered fort in the middle of downtown Vegas.  The centerpiece of DCP is a play land for kids that made me want to be eight again.  If it would not have been creepy or I would have ran the risk of getting stuck in some contraption, I would have bounced all over this steel, kiddy wonderland.

There was lot's to do and see.  We saw everything from hotdogs, booze, chocolate, glass, booze, booze, jerky, and an art gallery.  I hope to write reviews on many of shops we stopped in and spent money.

What makes this novel location a four star instead of a five is the tight quarters and a closed rest room.  Depending on where and when you visit, the potential for someone to touch you and breath on you is great.  For the most part everyone was cool, but you do have your selfish idiots out there.

As for the rest room, I stood outside one for almost 10 minutes.  I did not know the layout inside and assumed it could have been meant for a single individual.  Two employees would eventually exit and tell me the restroom was closed.  I told them it would have been helpful if there was a sign.  One of them told the other there should have have been a sign outside.  Whatever.

All in all, the environment and atmosphere is hip.  The businesses are for the most part...friendly.  I did not see you vagrant or doper.  Thank you to the ranger's who are manning the entrances.  

We look forward to checking out the DCP again!

Welcome addition to that end of Vegas.  I got there pretty late, so most of the businesses were closed but it seemed like a quaint little area with shopping, eating, and a great area for the kids to play.

Weird that I haven't written a review about Container Park yet as it is one of my favorite places to go!

If you're in the downtown area and you're looking to explore like a big kid... Container Park is your place. 

There are tons of little shops, eateries & a few bars tucked inside this enclosed park. All of the small businesses surround an adult playground. Can kids play here too? Absolutely. But it's also big enough for adults and I love it! There's a treehouse that you can climb and slide down slides... it's great! There is also a huge Simon Says like game to play and foam blocks to build random things. Everything is illuminated at night, which makes it look that much more cool. 

A few times that I've visited Container Park, in the evening, I've been able to enjoy live bands preforming. There has been seating in the lawn area to relax on - not sure if this is  forever thing, or just for planned shows. There is also seating located randomly around the park to enjoy food, a book, drinks... whatever's clever. 

During the fall they had movie nights... I also remember reading about Doggie Date nights.  Seems like there is always something going on so  if you have time to plan your visit, scope out the website first. 

There is so much to do here, I encourage you to really explore the place. You'll have a blast and find neat stuff!

Great addition to downtown Las Vegas.

It's a great alternative to townsquare or the linq. it's got a bit of a hipster flair. I love that the stores are local stores, not big chains. on the weekends they have live music. i hope this place really takes off. for the time being, it looks like there's not a whole lot of foot traffic to the park. i've heard a few tenants complaining about lack of advertisements and subsequent closing of the smaller stores. locals should definitely come and check this place out!!

Pretty cool spot to hang out when you're in old Vegas, Fremont st. It has an adult play ground...slides and a tree house. Also cool trendy stores and bars to check out. One of the many hidden gems in old Vegas. Check it out.

I was definitely more impressed than I expected for my first visit to Container Park, but I will have to come back during a day when all of the shops are open. 

The overall design and concept is really cool and innovative! As a born-and-raised Vegas native, I hope to see more places like this to get developed throughout the Valley.

Raw Vegans, kids & carnivores. There is something for everyone here. Amazing for kids. Loved it! Such a creative dining and play space. Well-curated blend of restaurants, pubs and shops with fun things to see, giant legos, climbing areas and live music.

This is definitely an area that supports small business owners, which I can appreciate. I like the idea of re-purposing shipping containers, but most of the establishments I went into and definitely enjoyed had me wishing they were bigger. 
Anyway, there were a good variety of shops, restaurants and bars. Always admired the play area there 'cause they keep it nice and clean for families. That's especially helpful when everyone stops by after marathon events and such. Also like the stage area on the south side of Container Park 'cause they also host family-friendly events there. 
Favorite art pieces are definitely the Praying Mantis and the Heart Locks at the entrance. 
Favorite establishments are JinJu Chocolates, Black Cup (attached to Cheffinis Hot Dogs), The Perch, Oak & Ivy, Big Ern's BBQ, BluMarble, Winky Designs, and Kapp Toys.

Nice clean hangout for an hour or so to bide your time while in Sin City. Close by metered parking for $1 an hour. Clean restrooms and recycling bins throughout. I like that concept. 

There is a playground with a fun electronic structure game (sort of like Simon) and a treehouse with three slides. One of the slides is very tall and steep, and we kept getting static electricity (the worker said this happens all the time). Bummer...my daughter didn't want to do it again because of this. 

We enjoyed refreshing popsicles and a perfectly delicious red velvet cupcake here as well. There are also boutiques and other eateries.

Such a cool spot! Great shops, food and overall atmosphere! The food is all pretty darn good, not a fan of the Mexican place... Very bland and dry. The vegan place is really good... And you don't miss the meat and cheese.... Which is really surprising!!! Also the hotdog place is really yummy!

Hubby and I promised to take our daughter to this park which is east of Fremont Street. It is only a few blocks away from Flippin' Burgers. 

As we got there, there were activities in the park for kids. The playground is centrally located as the gates were watched by security who makes sure the kids are with their parents. Seems like there is not to much to do but go down slides. There is a level where you have to be taller than 4'7". A guy was manning the entrance to that slide. There are no swings or anything else but big building blocks that were taken by little toddlers. Not too many places to sit. 

Surrounding the playground were little shops and food eateries. We saw a bbq place, Mexican food shop, candy shop, etc. My daughter got to make her own paper lantern with the help of her dad and a girl who was guiding the kids to make it. 

After that, we saw a lion dance/dragon performance. Good for all ages. There were stands giving free stuff such as bags, cell phone chargers, ear buds, etc. Very cool. The only thing I disliked was how crowded it got. I don't like crowds. Other than that, I enjoyed looking at the shops. Good for the family and kids. Take them here.
it's small but packs a lot of punch! many boutiques here that are unique. family friendly as well.

Cool spot downtown. Great for families just not during the afternoons in the summer. Cool stores and restaurants, a stage for concerts and other entertainment available as well. Architecturally very cool to see how they transformed actual shipping containers. Definitely worth checking out.

This place was a great stop for the family.  The kids easily spent a happy hour or so playing in the tree house play area and with the foam blocks in the grassy area,  and we ended up eating lunch here as well.  There's plenty of outdoor tables as well as indoor seating at some restaurants,  though a couple of the restaurants are 21+ so not family friendly.  Still there are kid friendly options like a gourmet hot dog place and Perch.   Plus step outside the container park and you can walk to several restaurants.   We peeked in eat, which is almost directly outside the rear exit of the park,  and it looked super busy.  It must be good. Street parking seemed plentiful and costs $1/hour.  You pay for street parking at pay stations, and they take credit cards which is convenient.  The kids also liked giant metal praying mantis parked in front.  Most of the shops were very small, and seemed like local artists. We'll probably stop in again on another trip.  It's nice to support local businesses and this downtown area is undergoing an interesting transformation.

Had an unpleasant experience at the DCP on 4/11/2014 just before Sheryl Crow came out to perform. The group I was there with was sitting in the grass area near the back edge by the walkway about center stage. Due to discomfort I get in my knees from sitting on the ground I opted to stand behind them at the edge of the curb. I watched the entire Charlie Worsham performance in this position.

During the intermission between Charlie Worsham and Sheryl Crow I was approached by someone that works there and was told that I would have to sit in the grass or move. I explained to him about my situation and why I'm unable to sit on the ground for very long periods. He told me that the grass area is considered general seating and therefore you must sit when in that area. I didn't buy his reason and he said he would go get security. 

A short time later he returns with their security personnel and they said the same thing that I must sit if I'm going to be in the grass area. Then they further stated that I could not stand in the walkway between the grass area and the bleachers behind. They said that the walkway must remain clear at all times and no standing in it is allowed. At that point I was told by security that I must leave because I didn't comply with their request to sit on the ground.

I left and was headed for the exit and waited a few minutes before walking out of the park. By this time Sheryl Crow was coming out on stage and as soon as she did everyone in the grass area was standing up on their feet to watch her performance. Also the walkway that they told me that has to remain clear and no standing allowed in it was filled with dozens more people standing in it. I returned to the spot I had been standing at previously and watched the concert with hundreds of other people standing in the grass. 

I looked around for the employee and security guards that confronted me earlier and they were no where to be found. Interesting how they come along and make up their own rules to harass someone while there was no performance going on at the time but once the main act started I didn't see them making everyone else sit and clearing the walkway.

This place is good stuff. The wife and I personally enjoy so many aspects of the Container Park. We recently purchased downtown after some in depth research and investigations. We've been hanging out downtown since I moved here in 09 and have loved it since the first night I stepped food into the Griffin to grab a drink. Container Park is a huge step in the right direction and we love what they are trying to do w/ it. Seeing things like this and Inspire go up gives us a feeling of  happiness to see that we get to be a part of the development of the East Fremont District and watching it grow and evolve is awesome.

Beware of the waking of the mantis lol. This is another really cool thing that they do here. All the kids gather around in the entrance next to the mantis and they do a drum circle to wake it. They keep banging on their drums until the mantis wakes and spits fire out if its tentacles. It's warm and definitely will make you jump if you don't expect it. Definitely good for laughs to watch the random people get startled.

The Thursday Movie Nights were the best thing since sliced bread! They provided blankets, pillows, floaties to lounge on and other various forms of seating. They played some classics like Indiana Jones, Weekend at Bernies, Goonies and Stand By Me. You were able to grab food from one of the eateries and bring it out to watch the movie and chow down. They even had a pop-up bar right in the grassy area.

They put on small concerts there also. We've heard some great live music while there on numerous occasions. 

The food options are plenty. My wife and my favorite choice is Big Earn's. They are super affordable and really good. Don't forget the free refills there on non-alcoholic beverages to add the "cherry on top".

I did hear about the 2nd and more so the 3rd levels of shops having problems drawing customers. I could see how that could happen especially since a large portion of the people I see there are families w/ kids. They probably don't want to deal w/ the hassle of dragging the kids up there to see what there is.

No kids after 9pm makes it somewhere that both families and adults can frequent. You can even play the cool light game and go down the awesome slides after 9p.

Just stumbled upon this while walking around downtown Vegas after eating at Eat. Very cool mini retail area/live work/playground. Its looks really cool as obviously its built from containers. I had just eaten, but the Mexican restaurant sounded really good. Also, had a couple of bars AND a huge playgrounf for kids. Only in Vegas I guess. Also, have a pabilion and live music. These folks said we gone target anybody that comes this way. Worth checking out especially if you don't gamble and get tired of the strip in like 10 minutes.

Very creative place. What a way to recycle all those box cars rather than letting them sit in a bone yard. Go Vegas for your efforts to keep our environment clean. I visited this place based on this fact alone I wanted to see just how does one turn box cars into buildings. I was impressed very upscale atmosphere. Lots of restaurants, shopping, a stage with a grass meadow for concerns, Family friendly with a huge tree house and park for the kids to play. Lights on the trees to give a romantic setting and low key music to set a nice mood. In the front is a huge praying mantis with a DJ inside. Only thing I didn't like was how they shut down the shops so early it was Sarturday night and they shut the doors at 8pm in a 24 hour city just found that odd. Besides that I will definitely be back for those amazing tacos/ margaritas and shopping.

A great attraction just down a bit from the covered portion of Freemont St.  Certainly a bit of a "hipster" vibe too it with many random shops of eclectic nature more targeted for the ladies.  Several decent dining options around the outsides, with lots of outdoor seating.  There's a big play area for children in the middle that's built like big tree house.

Well worth a stop in if you're in the freemont st area.  Look online and check out live music timing for entertainment inside.

Neat little area to walk around in.  Food and light shopping available.  Very close to the downtown Fremont area.  We kind of just stumbled upon here so I wasn't really sure what to expect but it looks like they may hold concerts here or live performances in general.  There is also a small park for kiddos.
A great break from plastic Vegas. Real local artists and vendors. Go and support them. A couple interesting eateries too.

Located on the corner of Fremont and 7th, just look for the giant preying mantis statue next to the entrance. If you're visiting Fremont experience, sure it's a close walk.  I wouldn't stray too far away since it's not the best of areas. 

Parking surrounds the container park on the side streets by either meter or paid lots.  Sometimes it is a bit tedious finding a spot during the peak times but usually not a far walk.  

It's a hodgepodge of stores, bars and eats.  Honestly I usually only visit for JinJu Chocolates.  There are some unique shops but nothing that blows me away. Otherwise the container park is just ok.

This was a pretty neat place to see but it didn't have as many restaurants as I thought it might. For sure check out if you are in the neighborhood, but as a tourist I wouldn't necessarily explore if it's the only reason you are in the Fremont street area.

Took a visit to Container Park with my husband recently... Great place to just hang out.  It is quite small, smaller than I expected.  However, they have a stage for free concerts, saw one while there.  A park in the center and all shopes and restaurants surrounding the center.  If you would like a good seat, I suggest coming early, I heard they get a line outside when they begin to fill up.  On the way out there were drummers in the front getting ready to just have a ball, they had drums you can rent and just hang out and bang out! Fun stuff!

I think it's important to realize that this place has been created with "us" locals and "local businesses" in mind. A neat concept and a good place to play and decompress. Whether you work directly or indirectly with our awesome guests it's a great place to unwind. My favorite bar is here. The guys are fun to watch at work. Lots of neat places to spend a few dollars to make your hearts feel warm and fuzzy. 

Fish, lizards, coffee, great food, events, ALCOHOL, and more...chocolate, dry rubs. Yes damn it I failed composition. Hurry and get here quick.
"Unique " we enjoyed our visit.  Diffently  the most family oriented place that I have visited in LV

Really like the concept of the place!
Something different for Vegas!
First time here was during the day with my son and friend and we had a blast!
This place is definitely for the kids when the suns up!

At night, is as you guest it, for adults!
They enforce the 21 and over rule, ID at the door or no go! 

Bars and restaurants were the only places open. The clothing stores and other specialty stores were of course closed.

Over priced for food and drinks, but honestly you pay for the ambience!

Overall still a great place to take my son or go out with friends at night!

Don't come here if you aren't 21. It was 9:30 and I'm 18 and I got kicked out lol. Apparently because there's alcohol? That's like saying I can't walk on the strip because there's alcohol everywhere. Paid for 10 dollar parking and didn't even get to walk around. Pretty sure the "21 and over rule" isn't posted anywhere either thanks for nothing! Thought this was a mall and playground not a giant bar.

I was very happy to hear about this addition to DTLV. It is right near Fremont Street so you can enjoy both spots on the same night. I do think there is equal entertainment for kids during the day than there is for adults at night. I went at night time and when I arrived I did see kids in the playground in the middle of the "park" which is a very impressive play area with big slides that go way high up. Pretty cool I would imagine for kiddos. At 9 p.m. they made an announcement that the park was now 21 and up. I have to say, I like this. I find it odd that people walk around Fremont Street with babies and little kids with drunk people and all kind of crazies all over. I like that they check ID before entering and there are security guards at the entrance and standing all over the park actually. I'm not sure why there is so much security, but hey I felt safe in this sketchy area. Now walk outside and that's a different story!

The park has a really cool stage with bands playing live music. Behind the stage is a barber shop in a train. Such a cool concept! There is also an area in front of the stage with large foam lego pieces and long sticks and a bouncy ball laying around that random people would play with, take funny pics, and go on their way.
