I would check the website for up coming bands. 

There is an old caboose which has been turned into a barber shop. Bring the kids because I am sure they have never seen one of these in real life. So it's like visiting a museum while shopping and eating. 

I highly recommend getting out of the casino area and walking here. You will enjoy relaxing in the sun without the pressures of Vegas beating down on you. Trust me when I say, you will be happy you did.

This place is ok. Parking was a nightmare and ended up paying $15 for parking. Playground staff were beyond annoying me when my son said 3 times she wouldn't let him on the slide when he was tall enough. So i had to take my happy butt up there and tell her he's ok and he is tall enough. The guy who guards the gate clearly sees I'm sitting on the chair with the table right out side of the playground I can still see my kids. He said I had to be inside the playground. All the shops are overpriced and to small. Don't think we will go back :/

Awesome fun place to hang out. Great place to go if you want to avoid the crazies on the tourist side of Fremont street.  The container park is fun place especially after 9 pm when it's 21 and over so adults can be kids sliding down the massive slide and listening to music on the grassy field or from the many seating areas around. A great place for girls night, date night or just hanging with friends. Also a good for people of all ages!

Ein geiles Teil von Vegas, besser gesagt, war dies und Downtown an sich das einzige, was mir in Vegas gefallen hat. In dem Container Park gibt es viele "Food Trucks", die aber nicht in Trucks sind, sondern in Containers. Es gibt einen guten Kaffee, handgemachten Schmuck und Leckereien von Tacos, Burgers, Briskets bis zu Brunchlokalen. Es ist nicht weit von den Golden Nugget entfernt und man kann in der Nhe um 1-2,50 Dollar pro Stunde parken. Sollte auf jeden Fall auf eure "To Do Liste" fr Vegas sein.

LOVE this place! I've been here couple of times thus far, love the vibe. Very relaxed, there is live music in the PM, few restaurants, Boozery (YES PLEASE!), few specialty stores and a giant tree house in the middle. There is something for every age, really worth going to at least check it out.
Very hip addition to vegas. i will argue even better than the tourist packed strip. All the shops and restaurants are super unique. Great customer service. Giant playground for kiddos.

This is a pretty cool hipster hangout. Don't be offended, lets be honest, you're at least part hipster just for wanting to go here, and yes, that is a bad thing. This place has so many cool little shops there are unique and one of a kind. The decor is very modern and urban at the same time. Plenty of options here to wet your whistle or fill your belly. There is even a play area in the middle for those future hipsters. The place is clean and everyone is friendly, surprise.

Everyone kept raving about container park like it was the coolest place to visit in Vegas. I was extremely underwhelmed to say the least. There weren't really any shops or restaurants there that seemed interesting enough to visit again. The only cool part was the fire shooting praying mantis.

Located on Fremont Street in Downtown Las Vegas, so here is the good news, if you take a stroll around and nothing captures your fancy, worry not , apparently the tenants change up quite often, due to high rent and the fact that hipsters that inhabit downtown don't spend money. But seriously folks, there are some good restaurants, shops and people watching, so give it a whirl. Live It Up You Are In Las Vegas For Cryin' Out Loud!

Very cute little random part of Vegas in the arts district. Didnt' have as many shops as I'd hoped, but still pretty cool nonetheless. If you live in Vegas & have kids & need something for them to do for a while, I would definitely suggest dropping by Container Park. I was able to get a cutesy book for my unborn baby nephew from the toy shop, but that was about all I found. This is a great idea & it would be cool if they opened something like this up in the Bay!!

Container Park is a cool idea and while I enjoyed my visit I didn't think it quite lived up to all the hype. 

The Good: Most of the park is a playground for kids. It was the best playground I've seen at any Vegas park with several unique elements. I would have begged to come here all the time as a kid. The BBQ restaurant is decent and the Mexican place looked like a place worth trying on a future visit. Chillspot had yummy frozen treats and Jinju chocolates was a solid dessert choice as well. There is a good variety of shops for such a tiny plaza.

The Meh: The overall area isn't that big. This is about a 30 minute drive for me and I can't see regularly driving "that far" for what is offered. For Las Vegas the parking is too difficult. In full disclaimer I know that I'm spoiled here and compared to other city parking situations this is a breeze. I was excited by the variety of shops, but didn't find them to have merchandise I'd be interested in buying. Additionally, the shops weren't interesting enough to draw my return visit. 

This is a cool hang out on a nice day to grab a bite, a sweet treat, and walk around. If I had visitors in town that wanted to check it out I wouldn't hesitate to return.

Went for a stroll through the container park as most businesses were closing around 9pm on a Wednesday night. Lots of independent small business retail and eatery  type places. Looks like there is something for everyone, young to old. Seems like an artsy local crowd. Classy, with something new to see. Live entertainment and movies on the weekends. Bars keep the traffic flowing at night.

Our hotel was across the block and we could see the fire breathing metal sculpture from our room! Pretty freaking cool! Free admission too! 21 and over after 10pm.

Would recommend to anyone looking to kill an hour or two/take a break from gambling!!!

Hipster alert! This place is very artsy! CAlso, there's a fire breathing praying mantis at the entrance. I wish I would have come earlier to browse the shops. My husband and I happened to stumble across this gem while leaving Old Town Vegas.

Going down a star after my experience this weekend. 

I do really love what they are trying to do with this place. But, if you are going to sell and advertise alcohol, don't make your patrons feel like criminals when consuming it!!!!

First, we ordered cocktails at the Boozery, only to notice the sign on the patio telling us to stay put with liquor. There was a security guard standing just outside the patio leering at us. So, in order to meet up with our friends, we quickly downed our overpriced cocktails and ordered beers so we could take them and go. 

We sat at a table next to the play area so my friend could keep an eye on her kid. We had 3 security guards within the span of 10 minutes come and tell us that in ordered to be allowed to sit at the table, we needed to be consuming food. 

Now, I admit that I don't know all the legal ins and outs of liquor laws, but I'll never order a drink here again. I seriously felt like I got verbally assaulted for it, and I couldn't even enjoy my drinks.

It would be better if this place gave you an instruction manual on alcohol consumption. Ridiculous.

We LOOOOOOOVE Container Park! 

Great experience ever. 

The kids love to be able to run around and with me being a full time masters student and stay at home mom, I love the idea of being able to come here let the kids run around and play in the play areas, have a few drinks and study. He live music is always a PLUS!!! 

On the weekends, my husband and I can come relax with friends and have brunch not worry about anything and just have a great time trying from all of the restaurants here.  

Amazing ambiance, chatter, and cleanliness! For it to be such a high traffic zone, the bathrooms are ALWAYS CLEAN when I have gone and I can APPRECIATE that being a clean freak!!!! 

Awesome job guys!!! Simply amazing!!!

Wow what an amazing place . All these little shops live music and food . Has a play area for the kids . Just the vibe Is really chill .We really like this spot . Super relaxing area .. We love Vegas an all the fun things to do..

This is really a perfect place to hang out with your family or friends. First let me talk about how cool it looks like. It looks really cool since everything is made out of package containers. There's also a playground. It's huge! It has really high slides, building blocks, and this game where you have to click a button when it's lit up. Outside the park there is also a giant mantis that spits out fire through its antennas. There's not really that many shops and restaurants but I'm fine eating and shopping there. Note all stores and restaurants are kinda tiny and pretty. There are 3 stories and a little garden area with a field of grass. I totally recommend just coming here to play at the playground.

Considering it is a "one of a kind" attraction in the area I'm willing to say, yes, I am a fan of Container Park.

With its artwork and fire-breathing grasshopper-thing there is no shortage of areas to grab a cute pic, or take a selfie. Both times I've been here there have been children and adults alike enjoying the space. Strangely enough, the children/adult vibe here works and causes me no irritation.

I've tried Pinches and SweetSpot here and I am looking forward to trying a few more places and exploring further. 

It's worth the trip to see it - even if you only do it once.

Big con - parking is horrific. Ever since the Downtown Project started El Cortez has stopped allowing people to patron their parking garages for free. *womp womp* So be prepared for street parking and metering.

I wasn't impressed with this place.  We visited April 12th and it was hot inside the park.  I can only imagine how scorching hot it will be in July and August. The food stands had a really long wait and you had to stand in line to order...not fun in the heat.  There are many little aluminum tables and chairs to sit and relax/eat/drink, but then again it will be scorching hot to do so in the summer.  The shops are just little local artisian shops, not really worth seeing more than once.  Container park might be better at night since they have live music and it would be a bit cooler at night.

Collection of small specialty shops and restaurants occupying large storage/trucking containers. It's a clever idea and worth checking out especially if your already in the Fremont area. We spent about an hour there and enjoyed some good BBQ food at Big Ern's. 
Also would be a good place for children.

Swung by here on a weekday holiday morning, with juice and doughnuts in tow from neighborhood hot spots.  Very cool layout - monster playground in the middle and what looks like a sweet stage. There were all these signs about not bringing in outside food/drinks but nobody gave us any guff. The subtext of a lot of signage was keeping the "leisured indigent" from setting up camp here, all part of the Zappo-ification of downtown.  A neat option in a cool place.

This place was really cool! Especially since we don't
Drink or gamble.its off of the normal Vegas strip.The shops were all in shipping containers! It looked as though they were stacked halfhazardly.We ate at Pinches Taco's which was fabulous, they even gave a sample of cooked cactus which delish. We sat on the second level above. We watched flames shoot out of the praying mantis's antenna every few minutes.The play area is awesome! There is foam building blocks for a fort, kick balls and multi level tree house with numerous tube slides. There's a stage area for live entertainment. The night we were there a large screen played cartoons while children kicked balls around the grassy area. Parents sat in the comfy chairs surrounding it. The play area only gets better after 9! Adults only on the playgrounds!!!

I'd been wanting to check out the Container Park and hadn't gotten around to it.  Visitor to the rescue!  Hubby #1 was in town and he hadn't been to Vegas since before most Yelpers were a gleam in their parents' eyes. So off we went - me, him, and Herb G.  (It's complicated).

We parked one block over and thought we were walking into it, and wondered why they were giving out free donuts and AYCD open bar.  But we were right next door, at the Learning Something-or-other, where every first Tuesday there's an entrepreneur conference for the Downtown Project.  It was 6 pm, so we apparently dodged the wristbands that we supposedly needed to get in.  All very confusing, but once the bartender set us straight (and got us a little smashed) we headed next door to the Container Park.

It's a delightful place!  Unfortunately, on May 6th, the temperature was too COLD and it was too windy to enjoy it fully.  A girl band was playing and they were excellent, with the unusual addition of a cello player.  Lots of seating, a decent clean bathroom, an elevator, adorable kids' play area, and places to eat that we'll get to try when the weather warms up and we can sit outside.

Loved the fire-breathing grasshopper sculpture at the entrance, and didn't mind two of Metro's finest cuffing and searching two dudes on the corner, since security inside the Container Park is really good.  

There are some intriguing retail establishments that I'd like to check out next time, but we were all chilled to the bone, despite dressing for the weather, so we had to cut our visit short.  Bummer, but definitely a destination.

When I read about this place, I thought to myself, I had to come see for myself.  Once I visited the location, at first glance while walking in the main entrance, quite small for a park/ retail area. I was listening to a cool string version of poker face music, and I thought it was a playback cd they playing I saw the all female string band playing those cover music on the park outdoor stage, from this point forward I was blown away.  This place has a killer Mexican restaurant, the burrito I ate there is delicious.  This place even has a open bar for those adults who want to get there drink on.  This place has a beef jerky store and hat/t-shirt store and made in USA. I have nothing bad to say about this place but one thing I didn't like is the paid parking.

Came by at 10 p.m Monday night and mostly every store was closed but JoJos jerky was amazing and the owner is SUPER informative and gave us tons of samples of sauces and jerky. 

The adult play ground is beautiful but the largest slide was closed off and the smaller slide is a wild ride, I actually hurt my back going down it. 

The bbq place smelled amazing, my friend got a "hotlink" and said it wasn't even spicy and the sweet tea wasn't even sweet whatsoever.

The giant praying mantis was super neat but I felt like my face was melting trying to watch it. 

Overall I feel this place has tons of potential, they just need to keep businesses open later

GO. That's all I want to say. Go to the Downtown Container Park. If you're on Fremont visiting the casinos you're literally just a five minute walk away. It's on Fremont and 7th can't miss it. The nicest people working here, it's SAFE, FUN, and there's something for everyone! Art, Shops, Restaurants, Bars, a Playground, Movie Nights, Concerts you name it it's here! Tons to see and do at the Container Park. It's clean, safe, fun, so creative and original! This is a kid friendly park, if you see any trouble get a security guard.

If you're down at the Container Park you should also check out Writers Block on 10th and Fremont for neat reads and cool chatchkis. Also there's a podcast called Downtown Podcast which is really fun too.

The energy and love at the Downtown Container Park makes me want to move Las Vegas. I love the up and coming vibe. Really fun and inspiring. You won't be able to miss it because of the giant praying mantis in the front. I love the playground, sounds weird, but it's adult size! The giant slide was closed when we went, but it's huge. I'll have to come back and get a better look at the shops and restaurants. Worth a visit, I hope you find yourself at the Container Park. 

Tips: It's safe as in they have security guards checking drinks and making people drink it or trash it before entering. It becomes 21 and up after 9pm. The security guards are locals who love their city, they are sincere good citizens who are really nice and just want to maintain a cool laid-back environment. Due to the fact that they are close to the wilder side of Fremont they have security on premises at all times to make sure no rowdy people come in.

This place is fantastic! There are a variety of shops and restaurants, all of which are local businesses. The architecture in the park is lovely, and there is a ton of outdoor seating, which will be great when the weather gets a little warmer (it's December now).

Of all the years I've lived here I had never even heard of Container Park - saw some posts about it on Yelp and decided to take the kiddos (and drag the hubby) to check it out. I have to admit it's a LOT smaller than I had imagined but on the bright side, very creative and very cute. 

The main attraction the Saturday we showed up was the kid's treehouse (not only for kids :) ) the kids - including my 1 year old - loved it. I couldn't believe how well they designed it, it reminded me of Tarzan's treehouse - minus all of the Disney themed add ons if you've ever been to Disneyland. Super cute. 

We did pop in to a few shops but not many since the kids were not having walking around since you can see the playground from every angle. Walked over to the grassy area to play with the over sized blocks and they loved that as well.

Overall, I would bring the kids back, if we were in the area...but not make a drive across town for it.

And just like any other park or playground, it was hot! A better activity for the cooler months indeed.

Cutting edge, innovative, creative, fun, friendly and safe.  Well done Tony and everyone involved.  The food, art, music and entertainment is just perfect for this corner.  A lot of tourist on the strip is missing out on this gem!
It's fun and hip! I hope Downtown Las Vegas continues to grow in this direction. There are some great shops here.

I definitely like the concept; feels like an area at Maker Faire with all these repurposed materials. It's a nice, wholesome contrast to the nearby Fremont Experience. 

Our daytime visit was good. We grabbed a couple Sasapops popsicles from their cart and rocked lazily on the wooden bench swing near the stage. In a city full of unique experiences, Container Park is perhaps the least like the rest of the adult entertainment in town. 

Most of the businesses were pricey, though, with only outdoor seating in absurdly hot weather. Since the high pricing seemed fairly universal, this may well have been small businesses compensating for their rent. 

At night, they light the praying mantis out front, and it becomes something out of Burning Man as the antennae burst aflame, ignited propane shooting into the dark sky. I happened to be there when a fire truck was sitting at the red light there. It honked each time the mantis blasted more propane. They played "Shave and a Haircut" back and forth. It was freakin' cool. 

The mantis lends its own thing to the bright, vintage lights of East Fremont. At the very least I'd say you should see the Container Park for it, with the Catalyst Dome changing colors behind it, at night.

As a tourist, I must say that I don't really see the appeal of this place. Yes, it's a fun idea to have a shopping center built out of shipping containers stacked upon each other. It looks great and interesting, but that's it. I've been there with some friends in the early evening, the sun was shining and it was hard to find the place in the shadow to enjoy a drink. We browsed the shops, had a really sugary lemonade in The Black Cup Coffee and after 30 minutes we were done. 

It's probably better for locals, especially families. The place is known to organize a lot of free concerts, movies and other entertainment. And the Treehouse looks like a great spot for the little ones.

I love visiting this place. It is good to visit during the day, anytime of the year, with or without kids. Note not kids are allowed after 9pm (which they shouldn't be anyway). Plenty of options to eat at and there are alway special events going on. My favorite feature is the park for the kids. Not your average park with the three story slide. I love the creative elements to this park including only have small businesses there. You won't find a corporate chain at the park but plenty of other options.
Love Container Park.  Nice clean environment.  Great concerts, unique atmosphere, gotta love Mantis as he entertains on the way in and out.  Don't miss this hidden gem in DLV.

Very cool find!!!
We stumbled on this place. 
Great place to find something to eat. 
Lots of choices! 
Had the flaming hot Cheetos grilled cheese at bin 702. 
Kids will love this place. There is a play ground in the center. 
There is also a stage with live bands.
I didn't find a lot here and it's not fully enclosed so it's better to come at night or on a cooler day. Nice to get out of the old strip theme and into a more relaxed atmosphere.

While I like the idea of this place, its not really a 'park'  it's more like a chic shopping Plaza that has a very uncomfortable announcement around 9pm every night saying 'if you're under 21 you must leave the park"... But there is a GIANT PLAYGROUND IN THE MIDDLE OF THE PARK. Why are there children in an area where there is open alcoholic beverages and its 9pm? Take your kids home! Lol

Other than that weirdness, my boyfriend and I truly enjoyed coming here, if only to walk around and window shop. I'll come back because I do open mic at a nearby coffee shop, but not because I feel like I need to be here.

I live downtown at Soho lofts and was disappointedly the fact that there isn't too much for toddlers downtown besides the Children's museum. Vegas is the worst possible place to raise a toddler but I try to make due. When the container park opened I was excited to see it. I was excited about the different shops and restuarants and couldn't wait to walk down and experience it. Especially since it's about a 10 min walk from where I live. The day after Christmas I decided to walk down and check it out with my son. When we got there we noticed 2 guys standing out front of the entrance kinda like dorky bouncers. I didn't know why they were just standing there but they said hello and we walked by into the park. I was in awe. It's so clean, chic, but yet it has this artistic feel without being too annoyingly hipsterish. The entire park is made out of recycled shipping containers and the best part is that they actually had an amazing playground right smack in the middle of it. Wasting no time my son promptly undid himself from his stroller and took off running for the play area. The slide is pretty epic. The slide is freaking 4 stories high. I kid you not. There's all these foam shapes and hula hoops for the kids to play with and it's cleaner than Disneyland. After an hour or so of playing we'd worked up an appetite so we headed over to one of the restaurants. There was a long line but the food was definately worth the wait. Bravo Zappos. Thank you for putting in a park that is family oriented and safe and clean.

A little taste of SF right in downtown Las Vegas!  The downtown project is really making downtown a destination.  I had heard great things about the playground and wanted to check it out and write about it.  So, lets get down to the nitty gritty.

We arrived around 4pm and my husband wasn't too thrilled about being downtown.  There is still a lot of uncertainty when you are there and we have yet to be downtown without an incident from a drunk or otherwise intoxicated stranger.  But he agreed to go.

They have valet but since there was parking on the street, we parked in a metered parking spot and were quickly entering the Container Park.

What did we love:  Well, we loved the security - gates and visual security guards.  We loved the design - artistically pleasing to the eye.  We loved the playground and building area - encouraging creativity in our kids and we loved the hang out atmosphere that we so miss from living in the city.

With outdoor seating, lots of restaurants and bars and a stage - this park was alive.  People were socializing and generally having a great time.

We didn't spend a lot of time in the stores, but they all looked eclectic and interesting.  We did participate in a drum circle on our way out of the park, which was a first for all of us.

Why only 4 stars?  And, really this isn't any fault of the park.  But, it is still downtown and of course we were forced to strategically navigate ourselves to our vehicle because of  very drunk and disorderly men on the 1/2 block walk from the park to our car.  Still, I have faith that if we continue to support the downtown projects efforts, it will pay off.

Pros: I discovered Container Park mainly because of a Freakanomics podcast talking about the CEO of Zappos wanting to start this place up for new business owners and revitalizing downtown Las Vegas. Container Park as definitely earned it's name because the stores are literally freight containers stacked up in an artsy kind of way. There is a large playground for kids in the middle and three stories of boutique stores. There are a handful of restaurants and drink places as well. Simply for the innovation, this is a cool sight to see! The staff that work here are also very friendly! The A/C in these stores are also very nice as the weather in Vegas can get kind of hot. 

Cons: Most of the containers (particularly stores) are really REALLY small so the selection is very minimal. The stores are definitely specialty stores so there are many stores that probably do not apply to your interest (though there is probably one that does). The parking can be a pain as the lot across charges a lot but the street parking is reasonable. 

Overall: This is a fun and innovative place to walk around and check out local stores and artists! Highly recommended as a source of entertainment outside of the Las Vegas strip!

It's hard to miss the Container Park when it's been headlining practically all the main Vegas magazines the past week. 

Yesterday, I finally got to taste the magic. Just like Disneyland, once you step inside, you are propelled into a completely different world - one that faces inward, shut away from the sketchy looking surroundings. Don't think Town Square. Don't start comparing. Just immerse yourself in what this place has to offer. It is what it is, a park, and people are expected to enjoy this place for its laid-back atmosphere, not exactly shop - although that is an option too!

The first thing you'll notice are the stacked shipping containers shelled with glass, revealing an artsy cluster of cafes, boutiques and galleries. Small local businesses line the first, second and third floors connected by stairs and continuous blocks of containers that would eventually lead you to a nice comfy sofa or table to sit on. Overlooking the balconies is the cute tree house which I was so tempted to go on and try the slides but I was too stoked with the galleries to even go for it. 

As you approach the back of the park, you will see a luscious green playground for kids to enjoy. With all the security they had there, I may trust the place enough to leave kids there (one day) while I go sit in one of the sofas by the cafe patio, overlooking them of course! Maybe. Still, I could not fully judge until I get to play in the playground myself! That's on my next to-do when I visit again soon. 

There's the industrial vibe it gives, urban mixed in with a Europhean flair of sophistication and great attention to detail.  That mantis up front immediately caught my eye because of its appearance at First Friday the two times I went. There's music as you walk and when the sun goes down, strings of lights leave a dreamy glow to the park. 

The Downtown project is reforming Vegas into a family-friendly cultural city, showing off its capacity to be more than a gambling hall. Win-win? I think so. Now we have our little piece of San Francisco. Environmentally friendly (separate waste disposals for different products), classy with emphasis on creating a vibe through art and music, hip people, unique concept. This place is my new heaven.

This place was a nice surprise.  I had not seen it before and wanted to check it out.  It's located across Fremont Street from the El Cortez.  The entire park structures are shipping containers.  We stopped in a couple shops and just strolled around.  There is a lot of funky art throughout the park and you can just sit and relax if you'd like and watch the people.  If you happen to be in the area, this is worth a stop.

Think of this place as the less seedy, less touristy and more family friendly sister to its neighbor The Fremont Street experience.  Don't get me wrong I love them both but, this place has more of a support local vibe to it with restaurants, shopping, live music, movies (seasonally), playground for the kids and a relaxed atmosphere.  It is also the type of place where you can actually speak to people you are with without shouting at them or waking up the next morning with your ears ringing from the extreme noise levels.

It is very compact and easy to navigate with plenty of easy parking in the area.  There seemed to be a good mix of locals and tourists hanging out here and it was a more relaxed alternative to Fremont Street or The Strip.  Plus the huge preying mantis was pretty awesome. 

I will definitely come back here to have cocktails and see live music again.

If you are from out of town skip this place. No outside drinks, no smoking, no fun!

Worst beef jerky I ever had from Jo Jo

I'm happy! Kids are happy!!! We visited this place yesterday and wow, Right in downtown on Freemont, keep walking and you run into this .  The entrance alone, From the heart with locks on it (Does anyone know what this heart was dedicated for? I call it locks of love, like in Paris, because I don't know what it is), To the praying mantis in front And some lighted up bubble dome next to it, All will find you curious intrigued and excited. As we entered the kids ran straight for the park right in the middle surrounded by Boutique style stores and restaurants in shipping containers. Although the park is downtown and built next to apartments or maybe rentals we did not feel any worry inside the park because they did have "security"presence everywhere. The kids played a good two hours in the park while The hubby sat I window shopped. The prices were a little high in some retail shops but the jewelry store was reasonably priced and they had cute and original items.Tip: not many choices of eateries, at least family friendly inviting, we ate before we came. 
 I love that Vegas (Zappos) has moved into the 21st century of family entertainment and social gathering. I've lived here for 18 years And places like these are much needed in this town. Yes it's Small but that's what makes it nice, especially when you're trying to keep an eye on your kids. It's not too overwhelming. This is not like the Grove in LA or Townsquare this is something different and unique. 
I like the whole "green" thing they have going on with the  containers and recycling bins all around the park. While sitting at a table watching the kids  one of the parents decided to "light up" and security told her that there was no smoking allowed. This made me happy. Yes you're outside but no smoking is allowed where the kids are playing. :) 
As we were ready to leave, around dusk, we were exiting & the employees of the park brought out drums and musical instruments (placed in a circle around the emcee) for all to participate in their musical serenade to the praying mantis, fire came out of its antennas. A good 15+ minutes of audience participation (mostly geared towards the kids). What a great way to end a day at the park! This is my new hang out  With the kids and my Mommy friends.

Love Love Love this place.

March 15, 2016 - we walked around the entire area & checked out the shops. Great smells coming from all the restaurants but the best thing ever was the Mantis. We went back for each night of our trip. 

Great place for kids too! My SIL and I climbed all over the treehouse but we are big kids anyway.

If you've been to Burning Man then you know the inspiration for Container Park. From the Giant Praying Mantis and geodesic dome at the entrance to the creative reuse of shipping containers the only thing missing is playa dust. The energy and dynamic that Container Park brings to downtown can't be ignored...and it's worth anyone's time to walk that extra block from East Fremont Street past the El Cortez to check it out. 

That being said I have 2 minor complaints about Container Park. 
1: Parking...sucks. Yes they offer valet parking but if you like to park your own car wear comfortable shoes as you're going to be walking quite a bit to get to it. 
2: It's not big enough! Container Park needs to be 2x the size. 

While Container Park has had some of the original businesses move out, once the management team gets the right mix of shops and galleries in place it's going to be a big draw for Downtown Las Vegas for many years to come. But I was pleased with the shops that are there now. Pricing can be considered a little high but you don't come out of the stores, restaurants, or bars and leave feeling like your wallet got burned. 

I'm no fan of Tony Hsieh and the Downtown Project but Container Park is definitely one of the better things he's spent money on down there. 4 Stars...and I can't wait to go back again!

My 100th REVIEW !! WOO.

Container Park is one of a kind, it's a really sweet place to check out during the day AND night. Bring kids during the day to play in the extensive playground they have in the center of the park. There is a good amount of small shops to pop into and browse, everything from glassware to jewelry to swimwear, etc. And if you find stair access to the second level, you can actually walk in the Container Park sign! Looks really cool at night too. Lighting is great and everything looks very modern. It's quite clean and there's usually security lounging around too. There's a giant metal mantis by the entrance to greet you. By nightfall, it is illuminated by changing colored lights and looks even more majestic. I hear it spews fire every now and then but I have yet to see it! 

If you're in town, definitely make a stop here. Careful with parking in the lots though, they're on top of what goes on with parking and all.. Make sure you pay for parking at the kiosk of the parking lot. And keep track of when you need to return. 

Love Container Park and the area it is in! It is away from the super crazy crowds and busy-ness of the Strip but you still get the excellent Vegas experience.

This park proved to be smaller than I envisioned, but entirely worth our vacation time and a welcome addition to the downtown scene.  I was surprised by the small size of some of the retail shops and question their continuing viability.  A few of the restaurants, notably Big Ern's BBQ and Pinches Tacos, seemed to be doing an excellent lunch time business.  The center of the park is devoted to a nice playground for children.  There happened to be a country band rehearsing and I was impressed by the quality of the sound throughout the entire complex. We talked to a couple of guards who said the park takes on a entirely different vibe during the evening.

What a gem! I had never been to downtown Vegas and it was a cool/authentic tourist experience. The container park has some cool local boutiques and plenty of food/drink. You can also walk around with drinks as you shop. Perfect afternoon with the girls!

I love that Las Vegas is evolving with wonderful establishments that focus on eateries, shopping, and family activities. Combine that with a wonderful recycling project and everyone feels great.

A fantastic idea to repurpose large containers and transform them into a park for all to enjoy. From the entrance complete with Burning Man's Flaming Mantis and container "Downtown Container Park" sign, you immediately feel welcome and whimsical. In the center of the park is a giant tree house playground and other activities for children. Surrounding it are two-story containers filled with various boutiques, candy shops, restaurants, and bars. In the back of the park is a barber shop train with a performing stage and large play area for children with several seating options for parents. The Lounge Orphans were performing at the time of our visit and they were really great!

We didn't eat or shop, so not much to say except that they're all very small. Seems to be an issue when the park is really crowded like it was on this Saturday afternoon. Other than that, I love the space: the live music, the beautiful weather, the fun atmosphere with balloon animals and face painting. 

Access is from Fremont Street and it was simple enough to find street parking nearby. We are a fan of the parking meters since it takes credit cards. It is enforced Monday-Saturday 8am-6pm, not including holidays. The cost is $1/hour for a maximum of two hours.

Found this place by accident and so glad I did! Non-smoking except for one section, with lots of unique restaurants and shops. Love the San Miguel shop! Love the vegan cafe Simply Pure! Live music, artists and art work on display, and a big area for kids to run around and play. The large insect shoots fire to music! My new favorite place in Vegas!

Fantastic addition to downtown. They had live music in the afternoon with comfortable seating and a children's play area. At night I understand it becomes adult only. For anyone who has been a long term resident of Las Vegas I am sure you will understand me when I say that it used to take either work or an act of Congress to get me downtown. Now I could see myself definitely making the trek for an evening out or an afternoon in the park. The only reason why I am giving this place 4 instead of 5 stars is because it is pricey. If money is tight though they do have a green space which looked perfect for a picnic.

The container park is nice and family friendly. LOVE the GIANT FIRE BREATHING GRASSHOPPER and yes, I jumped when it randomly breathed out that fire. It's a nice place to visit while bar hopping or if you want to take the kiddies to a a really cool playground or do some shopping. I was surprised when they let adults go down those super high slides, I honestly froze before going down the highest one, but man did that thing have some sharp turns. It wasn't too busy when we went, but I'm sure it'll pick up as more people make it the new hipster-dive spot and the live music is enjoyable to a refreshing beer/ warm cup of hot chocolate (whatever soothes your mood). Overall I liked it and I'll probably make another visit.

As of now I'm not sold on the Container Park.  My biggest problem is that it feels too enclosed and private.  It wants to make Downtown Las Vegas seem cool and cultured; but only if you're inside the Container Park!  Only one entrance & exit?  I get carded to walk into here?  No outside food or drink?  Kids are allowed, but have to leave by 9:00pm?  It's great that they've tried to create a family friendly environment, but once you leave you're quickly reminded that you're still on the corner of Fremont and 7th.

My favorite aspect of the Container Park is that it focuses on showcasing local businesses.  There seems to be a decent mix of retail, food, and drink spots, along with spaces reserved for art galleries.  Be sure to stop by JoJo's Jerky.  Later at night a curfew goes into effect, which allows adults to have fun on the playground.  Neat, but not really something I feel needs a repeat visit.  First time visitors, though, be sure to check out the ninja game and three story slide!

It's a neat concept to be able to walk into a conex and be greeted by sales staff and retail goods instead of construction materials and boxes, but I can't say that the Container Park is a must-see.
Great outdoor activity for the wholr family. I love this place. Park for the kids and bars for the adults.  Varieties of food and I love the live entertainment.

Very cool place to bring kids!  I have 4 children ranging in age from 13 to 4 and they all enjoyed the parks in the middle of the shopping "containers"

Lots of fun for adults too with some good shopping

We had a great time just playing in the park. The shops were closed and they were prepping for a private event. It was pretty empty. The Praying Mantis that blows fire is awesome. The park has cool slides and a huge simon says game. We had a great time.

A very trendy place to eat and shop! The park is made out of shipping containers, and has up-and-coming shops and restaurants. The central area inside here has a large play area with a slide for children. At the very end there is a stage where they often host live music. I attended a beer festival here which was very fun! It took us around the container park so that we could see the variety of shops.There are a lot of nice views also from the second and third floor of the city. Definitely go and check this place out!

Neat little shopping district to walk through.  The giant metal mantis in front was really cool.  Just a nice walkthrough as a break from Fremont Street.  Play area for kids is available.  Plenty of shopping and dining options.

This is definitely is a hidden gem! Friends wanted to walk around downtown and I'm glad I tagged along! I wish I was able to see this place during the day but we got here around 10:30pm. There was a security guy at the door to check everyone's ID since there are bars inside. There are some small boutiques, restaurants and bars. But more importantly, there's an adult tree house with slides!! There are other games in the "playground" as well and we ended up spending over an hour there. I was bummed that most of the stores were closed so we will definitely come back again!

Downtown Container Park is awesome for tourist and even locals. They have vendors, performers, bars, restaurant, and games. It's always a good time. You can be entertained by anything and also people watching. You can park in the parking garage, street, or local restaurants.

Love, love, LOVE this place. Thursday and Friday evenings offer a live band, there is a grassy area w/ couches and swing to watch the entertainment, Saturday is a movie. Tis great for family and adult time. Lemonade at the popcorn factory, amazing, Jojo's Jerky, more AMAZING, great food (the BBQ) and seriously tons of fun. It's small but love it for what it is and give it a chance. Adult fun is around 8:30p, kid fun in the mid afternoon to late evening. Adults only after 9p.

I love this place!! It is one of my favorite places to hang out and the 1st place I take friends and family members who come to visit me.  There are always really great shops and amazing restaurants but just the atmosphere itself makes this one of the best places to be.  I love how they play movies in the fall on a big screen and also live bands on stage! I watched the Superbowl a couple years ago as it played on that huge screen on stage while I ate outside at The Perch.

***PROS***
* Fairly easy to find parking (a little difficult to figure out the meters/parking spots. HINT: look down. Numbers are painted on the curb)
* Terrific preying mantis at the entrance
* Great toy store, Kappa Toy Store, at the far end of the park
* Clean bathroom at the left/front of the park
* Penny-press machine at the entrance
***CONS***
* Shops are small (with 2 other customers in the candy shoppe, no room for us to look around.)
* Not sure how to get into the play area at center of park. There's a small fence around it. Is there a fee? 
* Other than the toy store, and tiny candy store, what else is there to do for parents/kids in this area? Seems like a long trek for one toy store and some photo ops. 
* What are these shops? There's no guide, printed or on display. I need to know more!

Cool little shopping place. The kids really enjoyed it. 

Tree house was cool but slide was out of order. Big Lego's were really fun for my 10 and 9 year old. 

Cool little novelty shops and food shops.

I love it here! I've only been here during the day with the kids, & they absolutely love it! Super kids friendly! Love the little shops they have around the container park. Highly recommend if you want to be on some, "chill vibes" during the day.
Only great thing to eat is the BBQ place & Vegan place (try the nachos). Lots of kids if you don't mind them it's great, good place to waste time for tourists.

Container park was cool to see, but nothing special. The concept is neat and a great place for kids or families to hang out, but how are these restaurants and bars different from the places down the street? It's definitely a safer environment than the Fremont Street Experience but Container Park belongs in a better part of Vegas. 

I don't see the value in paying to park and hang out here. Yes, people may come here for a drink or two but who wants to go somewhere to relax with a park of screaming kids? On the other side, how is it responsible for adults to bring their kids here for a play-date if they are going to be intoxicated? 

Food for thought, but for now I'll continue hanging out at Town Square.

If you want a good place to just hang out and maybe grab some grub, this place is great.  This is kid friendly, adult friendly, pet friendly, etc.  

In all honesty, I think the reason why I love this place so much is because it reminds me of my hometown, Portland, OR.

Anything that reminds me of home deserves a five star!

Super classy place with an "adult treehouse" that was pretty fun to climb through despite like 3/4 of the slides being "out of order" (???). No outside drinks allowed which was pretty lame seeing as how there weren't really any bars inside (a restaurant or two but nowhere for a quick and easy drink). Nice atmosphere but I would really only recommend for shopping. The praying mantis though!!!!! I think she started up around 9pm and it was seriously one of the coolest things I've seen. Ever. The back story makes her even neater. 

While the inside of the container park is a neat concept and a very pretty space, you can skip it if you have a full drink and aren't interested in shopping (a condition of many who come to Fremont Street)  - just sit outside and enjoy the mantis's show.
Love what the down town project is doing. Awesome place to hangout even with your family.

Cute park in downtown Vegas. It has a very family-friendly vibe and kid playground in the middle of the park; an oasis of sorts in Vegas. Great outdoor space for concerts and events. The stores in the actual containers are on the small side. Because all of the stores have their doors closed, it somewhat detracts people from actually entering the stores to check out their products.

Love that they put this downtown and spruce things up. Very hipster and artsy. Lots of boutiques and unique eateries. They also have a stage and have bands play. If you go to the entrance, they have this huge preying mantis that has fire coming out of its antennae. Apparently it was in Burning Man. Also, they have doggie days once a week and you can bring your dog. Definitely worth checking out.

This place is such a great addition to the Las Vegas downtown and finally a family-friendly place in the area. There are a few restaurants and some shops and a great little grassy area for kids to run around. There is also a playground in the middle which is a hit with the kids. They have fun events like a wine walk, summertime movies, slip and slides, etc. We'd like to see more variety in bands, even more live music, and more entertainment in the future.

I finally made it down here for a meeting. It is an interesting concept. live stage for music,play area for the kids...some diverse shops and places to eat. however,it is still in downtown vegas and it is very small. Im not a big fan of getting stabbed while walking in the area,so if you go its like valet,container park,valet lol. They do have a groovy fire shooting psychedelic praying mantis at the entrance that's pretty cool...they also had a Mexican place there that didn't have a name on it ..i thought that was odd...after you have been here for 10 minutes its either get some drinks or dinner or get going..its probably much livelier when they have concerts...

Container Park is a very cool place! there was live entertainment and the guy was actually really good! Lots of cool local business' all located in a shipping container complex. Didn't have the opportunity to go into a lot of the business but definitely want to go back to check the area out a little more. Great play area if you have kiddos!

Catching up with a friend in Vegas and randomly we walked from downtown to here on purpose at night. Have to admit this place is pretty awesome and very unique because of the entire place is made out of containers and talked to a few of the shop owners to get to know the history of the place and very organic which is very cool! 

There are bars, brunch, coffee, slides/big legos for the kids. Many activities happen over here for everyone. You feel like a kid again and it's amazing! Haha If you are into supporting local this is the place for you!

This is a hidden jem! Took my kids and I was greatly impressed. The staff was great, plenty of security. The area was well lit. I must commend the former mayor and current mayor for cleaning downtown. Restaurants are close by and plenty of drinks.  Not a bad review. 

Not only was the area great but the band was awesome. Kudos once again

Love this idea of Container Park and the atmosphere - especially at night. During the day, it's a great place for families and kids with a big playground in the center and the huge play area in front of the stage. It mellows out a lot in the evenings once the kids are gone and the twinkling lights come on. There are lots of heat lamps throughout the park for the chilly winter nights. Lots of cool shops to browse. Only a handful of restaurants/bars. It's a smoke-free area with a smoking area above the Boozery.

This a really cool spot located on Freemont Street, was about a block or two from all the action. What stands out the most is the huge Mantis, that occasionally sings and blows fire, lol.  Inside there are shops, bars, food spots, lounge areas, and play areas. Looks like it can cater to the little kids during the day, and big kids at night,lol! Not to mention, the cleanest bathrooms, and security throughout, to make you feel safe!

This place is EPIC!
I could literally spend all day and night here. 
The vibe is awesome. There 3 stories of shops, eateries, and more. It has a cool kid playground, a stage area with fake grass, comfy couches and soft blocks for people to build/play with. They also have great music playing. 
Must see.

The Container Park is a great addition to Fremont Street.  It's super cute with a little children's park in the middle.  It's kind of shaped like a horse shoe with shops, restaurants and bars.  I love the wooden plank patios where you can sit and enjoy nice weather or watch your kids play in the park if you had any.  We stopped at the bbq place to grab a beer and just people watch.  It looked like an orchestra was setting up to play on the grass, which by the way is a perfect set-up for outdoor concerts and performances.  

We didn't stay too long as it got really cold, but can't wait to go back and have dinner and drinks.  it's just a very relaxed and fun atmosphere.  I like it!
Great spot great idea!  Bars are fun, what an excellent concept I highly recommend this place!!!  Great for start up businesses!

We had a great experience. The dcor was great. Kid friendly until 9:00 PM. Then it is shut down to those under the age of 21. Before that the place has a great atmosphere for kids.  There are lots of restaurants and fun things to explore. They had live music playing.  Was a ton of fun.

I absolutely love the total concept and vision of the Container Park. It is totally cool, chic, and a magnet for the hip crowd that is becoming the cliche place to be that is the Zappo's environment of Downtown.

Here are my thoughts:

a.  Concept - 5 stars - The idea to stack ocean containers and retrofit them to an urban shopping and dining experience is freaking awesome!  What a way to go and to create something special and unique.

b.  Restaurants - 3 stars - Plenty of bars and restaurants, however, on a busy day like today, they are both crowded and difficult to navigate. We were hungry and spying several places and finally said, the wait was not worth it, nor the difficult navigation.  So we opted to walk around a bit and then leave. The  issue here is that a Subway shop has more space to stay and order than the restaurants here.  The great thing is the variety, the style, the ambiance, the certain je ne sais quoi that makes the place so cool to be at. 

c.  Size - 3 star - For an urban environment and high density living style that downtown is attempting to be, my question is, why so small? the magnitude of the place is such a small scale. This will be great for nights when you have it crammed with the night life scene, but during the day, it should have plenty more space and places for people to hang.

d.  ShopChoice  3 star -- I thought that the choices here for shops were a bit odd. All cool boutiques, but where is the demand?  No one was carrying bags.  No one was buying stuff in the store. Every store I went into, it was a bunch of workers and sales staff. Hardly any buyers, but some lookers.

Summer - I wonder if they will have some kind of foliage or sun shades during the summer. This place is 100% designed to be an outdoor place and on this day when it was 80 degrees, it was not exciting to be out in the sun with no where to sit or relax.

This place would be so awesome if they turned it into an eating mecca and put tables and chairs everywhere and had a focused vision.  For now, it all looks awesome, but just seems a bit "off".

check the place out and enjoy it.  Be careful if you bring your kids.  By 9:00 pm, only 21 and over.

I love this place!!

What a refreshing establishment to add to downtown Vegas.  It reminds me of the cute outdoor malls in Southern California (think The Camp for example).  But with a twist since it's made out of containers, and this park has things to playyyyy with!

Legos, slides, foam blocks, Neos, fire-spitting mantis?!  The kid in me just wet my adult pants.

That mega slide is best done at night.  It'll take you on whips and turns and leave you with a whiplash you'd never expect.  Legos and foam blocks?  Stack them up.. then plow thru them with your fierce moves, since we all know you're the next MMA fighter.  Just make sure the kids don't cry or you'll be dealing with their parents.

Not to mention the array of food and booze!!  All these bars available one after another.. We had some local taps and the lobster grilled cheese at bin 702 and let's just say.. all I heard was ~ahhh~  voices of angels singing.

In front is a heart structure full of locks, which kinda is a rip off of Paris's Locks of Love Bridge, but ehh.. what else in Vegas isn't a rip off of some iconic spot huh?

DT Container Park is great for modern-day kid (ie.  grown-up kid).  Games, food, booze.  But putting all these bars in such close proximity to a playground?  Now that's the most dangerous game of them all..

It is a great place to go but it is smaller than I thought. Upon entering the park they have a huge praying mantis sculpture and a circus performer while I was there. Admission is free. They have a few shops surrounding the inside of the park and a few eateries as well. There is also a big treehouse for children in the center of the park which my daughter enjoyed for awhile. The tree also has various slides of different heights surrounding it. In addition, to the east of container park is not the best area and they have security at the entrance and within the park to make your experience feel more secure.

I will say that this park is a great first step in making the downtown area more family friendly or in the least have some place in downtown to take your kids for the afternoon.

Had a really fun time listening to a local band, Street Folk, perform covers at the stage in Container Park. Great little setup they have here with some fun shops and restaurants. I wish more of the restaurants were open past 9pm on a Friday night, but hey.

Very cute & off the beaten path.  An eclectic collection of art shops, specialty shops, trendy restaurants, a play area for kids and a music/stage venue - all in a compact park made up of shipping containers.

Young families, old couples, hipsters, toddlers, seniors.

Nice place to visit, stroll, shop and grab a bite or have a drink.

Being a native Las Vegan, I tend to have a love/hate relationship for this city.  The current mutation that DTLV has been overtaking, specially with the addition of the new Container Park has definitely rekindled my flame for this debaucherous whore-town :)

Container Park is like the mini version of Town Square.  Reminiscent of Lego blocks stacked on top of each other are the shipping containers which house boutique stores, restaurants and bars.  Each unit is about 200+ sq ft, so you can imagine how orgasmic one can get if 5 other individuals were to join you one container.  Nonetheless, the shipyard of containers expresses its own sense of individuality, offers quality in their product, creates an urban atmosphere  and makes DTLV all the more approachable.  My favorite part about Container Park?  Unfortunately it's not the giant flaming lazer-eyed metal mantis.. It's the kick-a$$ lounge areas on the 2nd floor overlooking the entire park.  The place is thankfully family-friendly equipped with a center playground and a three story tree house for the kiddos and it's also adult-friendly with its convenient wine bar and beer station so we all have the opportunity of becoming white-girl wasted.  Forever high-five Tony S!

I've driven by here before the park opened and promised myself I'd be back to check it out. Parking was fairly easy to find. There are tons of spaces on 6th and 7th street that were free when we went (Sunday). 

The architecture of this place is the most unique aspect of it. The brightly-colored shipping containers serve with style and function and allow small businesses and pop-up shops to have their own distinct space. The variety of little boutique shops was plentiful and when you need a break, there are a good amount of food, drink, and dessert options. Plus, there are a good amount of beautiful metal sculptures that greet you as you walk in the park. 

The park itself has a huge and impressive kids playground in the middle. I was really tempted to hit up some of those intense slides, but I likely would have been kicked out. It's a child's dream! 

When you get to the front, there was a string quartet jamming to some current popular songs that was projected through speakers throughout the park. Keeps the whole place alive! 

All in all, I got some pretty cool and unique finds from some of the Portland-feel shops. I'll definitely be back!

I should have walked around more.  I only got in next to the kids play area and sat.  But from what I saw it was a pretty cool place and a neat design.  Not sure how many actual containers were used to build this "park" but it's a unique idea nevertheless.

We went on a unusually very cool and overcast day in August.  So everything was comfortable as we sat and enjoyed our shaved ices.  The little play area seemed pretty cool with some game that everyone was trying, even the adults.  Speaking of adults, kids aren't allowed in the play area unless they have an adult with them.  Strange...usually it's adults not allowed in play areas unless they have a kid.  Oh well whatever.

They do have some mister/fan combos that probably really help during those super hot days.  You know, the ones that we missed while in Vegas?  Yeah those.

Honestly I probably wouldn't go back unless I had a particular business I wanted to go to.  This is one of those...you've been once, you don't need to go again.  But you do at least have to go once.  It's pretty neat.

Great place with great businesses, restaurants and atmosphere. I brought my grandson here to eat lunch and we had a blast. We ate ribs, had ice cream and really enjoyed the day. I would recommend this place to anyone who is in the downtown area looking for a great outdoor environment to have lunch:)

There's a lot more to Vegas than the mega-casinos, booze, strip clubs and celebrity chef restaurants. The Container Park, located downtown, is a family friendly place that attracts locals andtourists alike. The stores there are more like boutiques. No chain stores owned by a mega corporation here, just independently owned small businesses. 

At the entrance is a giant metal preying mantis. At night it takes on a new life by lighting up and shoots flames out of its antennas. This is something I'd expect to see at the Burning Man. Through the entrance, you'll see a collective of small shops in what lookslike repurposed shipping containers. In the center ofit all is a decent sized play area for kids. The top of a climb & slide structure is about 3 stories tall, but that top level may be subject to closure at times. Towards the back of the park is a stage where bands play. 

The Dome near the entrance is like a small planetarium, where the entire round dome acts as a movie screen. There are shows for kids as well as adults. Showtimes and lineups are on their website. Currently, Groupon has a deal so take a look if you like saving deniro. 

Shops here vary from hot dogs to truffles, a tatoo parlor, clothing boutiques, kettle popcorn and many more. This is a great place for out-of-towners to visit, and locals to bring the family. 

Worth checking out! I plan to go back on my next trip. 

Notes: 
* Paid parking along the streets surrounding the park. Mind your time or get a ticket, like the car parked next to me.
* Security guards are walking arond, especially the play area.
* Currently, Groupon has a deal for tickets to The Dome, so take a look if you like saving deniro. 
* Check their calendar for list of free events and concerts.

This lil park at the downtown end of Vegas near Fremont hotel is pretty kool for kids. It's urban trendy like the lab is Costa Mesa...and oc mix mart in fountain valley. All the stores are made of cargo containers. The lil park has a giant tree house, misting fan and electronic simon say jungle gym. Best thing is they have personnel working there to make sure kids play nice and done hurt them selves. Ur warned at the entrance to park: no running and if you are warned 3 times then you're out. The 3 strikes law. Lol.

Before my Vegas trip last week with my wife and my 5 year old son, i checked Yelp to find any activities or things we can do as a family, since my 5 year old isnt into drinking, partying or hitting up titty bars.

I came across this place and said we had to try it cause it sounded and looked really cool. We came around 1 p.m. and it was pretty dead. I have to be honest and say it was really cool. Its pretty small but alot of little interesting things to do with kids. It is amazing how all those teeny tiny shops are made of big cargo containers. We didnt eat or anything, but we let our son draw on the wall and i basically just chased him around and played tag for about 30 minutes in the treehouse. I bet this place is really fun at night when its 21 and over. We only stayed about an hour cause we had a drive back to L.A. to get to. Ill definately come back when i come back to Vegas, also the employees around were all super nice.

The best thing to happen to Las Vegas since that  white tiger ate Celine Dion's gigantic horse face.

Wait? What?  That never happened? 

Please tell me there's a giant metal praying mantis that shoots fire out its antenna out in front of a mall made from shipping containers surrounding a giant tree house with a four-story slide? 

Wait, what?  That's TRUE?  So there's hope for my Celine Dion dream yet.


All Hail Tony Hsei.  He hasn't just revitalized downtown.  He's transmorgified it.

This place is a real gem and a joy to visit while in Vegas for a different feel! So much to see! Great vibes, shops, food and drinks!! Vegan food too! Cool play area and nice shady trees to sit under. I loved everything about this area and what it's about and its goals for the future! Great shopping and pictures!!
Fun place to hang out and enjoy great food and drinks. I love that after 9 PM its 21 and over only. I always bring friends visiting town here.

I truly love, love, love this place! I went on a Saturday afternoon with my husband and a couple of my friends.

Let me start off with the parking. In a word, confusing. There is limited parking and be prepared to pay a few dollars. Not the end of the world, but just a heads up. It's nice that they have meters that you can pay with your debit card. No more rummaging through your purse or cup holder for quarters. 

Container park is actually made out of shipping containers. It is three stories tall in some places and surrounds a 50 foot tall "treehouse" that has several slides. The Park is definitely a family friendly place. It was funny because I kinda felt like I was missing a kid. lol (cause I don't have any) The whole courtyard area in between the shops is made just for youngins. They also have an amazing stage with a grass lawn in front of it. They had a live band playing which was awesome. Because they have speakers throughout the park, you can hear it all over. I could have sat there all day and just listened. 

There are a number of shops already established even though it hasn't been open very long. Lots of really interesting restaurants too! It was hard to choose which place to eat, but we all agreed on Big Ern's BBQ. Very delicious! Upstairs, I found the Lil Art Bodega to be the coolest place! I loved the art in there. If I could afford it, I totally would buy their Hello Kitty piece. I settled for a cool James Dean sticker instead. We also checked out the Vapor Loft. They were really nice guys and very knowledgeable. 

There are several other shops I didn't get the chance to go inside, but I noticed they had a Barber shop behind the stage which looked to be made out of an old train caboose. They also have a taco shop and even a Vegan cafe. Also, if you're in the mood for sweets, they have a cupcake shop and a ice cream shop.

I cannot wait to go back to Container Park!! They have something for everyone there. It is a great spot Downtown to take your kids or just yourself for a nice relaxing day of music, food and shopping. I'll be going back this Saturday evening to see my friend's band play!

Neat arrangement and an interesting mix of retailers.  Parking is available in a lot or on the street but is not free, at least during the day.  Neat giant praying mantis sculpture at the entrance.  Maps of the retailers are available as are staff who are more than happy to guide you if you ask the right questions.  But for the complete experience, best to browse through once before making any purchasing purchases.  Especially true for food.

I really love how much downtown has changed in the last 10yrs. I grew up in vegas and downtown has done a full 180! I love this addition! I like all the shops but I wish there were more substantial shopping. 702 boutique is my favorite store in there. I'm going to come back to try the BBQ place for dinner one night.

Found this while searching for kid's activities. It was a nice surprise. Our 4 year old had a great time playing in the play area. It's a great concept and what a great way to repurpose old shipping container. My kid's are getting all these ideas in there head about what they would do with an old shipping container. 
We were headed out and saw the staff setting up drums. Our 4 year old joined in and was quite happy until the giant prey mantis began spewing fire from its tentacles. 
We will definitely be back next time we are in town.

This is a great spot if you have kids or teenagers that need a place to hang out while the grown ups get drunk and gambled somewhere.  It's free admission. 

The park is not that huge and you will probably make it through in about 15-30 minutes depending if you go inside the shops and restaurants in this park. 

There is a "GIANT" tree house that any kid or teenager might like to explore here at this park. It looks really cool and nicely designed. 

We had to make a trip to this spot and it was pretty spiffy.  My wife bought a ankle bracelet from one of the stores inside this place. There are numerous stores and eating places in here. 

Even though we didn't eat here today, we might next time.

There is a GIANT MANTIS that shoots fire at night time.  Must see to believe.

Every time another place opens in downtown Las Vegas, it excites me sooo much!  This city is blowing up with start ups and community-centered businesses and is really helping to revitalize this city.  Downtown Container Park is no different.  This place started from an amazing concept to reuse shipping containers to create a center full of shopping, dinning and family centered options.  On it's site, they look for "businesses that will provide the kinds of services that Downtown residents need to create a live, work, play environment in our neighborhood. We prefer owner-operated businesses that reflect the unique personality of the emerging Downtown rather than chains or franchises."  I really like that preface.  

When you arrive, you'll notice a very aesthetically pleasing sign that says Container Park.  To the left of the sign is a huge metal sculpture of a pray mantis that shoots fire from it's antennas.  What a focal point!  When you enter the center, you'll notice the middle of the courtyard is a playground for kids, slides, building blocks and more.  This park includes locally owned business like boutiques, galleries, fashion stores, bars, restaurants and more! In the back of the park, there's a stage for local artists to perform and allows a very entertaining area for the various customers.  At all times of the day!

This is a very cool and vibrant option for the city of Las Vegas.  If you have not checked out the Container Park yet, please do so!  You will be amazed!  Go down the slide.  It fits adults as well.  Have a drink, get a bite to eat and enjoy the scenery!

What a great find on Fremont Street. Our daughter loved the foam blocks and big legos on the lawn. It wasn't a terribly hot day for Vegas (in the 90's), but the spray fans did help. 

The slides were cool, but too bad about 3 of them were closed. I liked the fact there were security guards inside and the park was the center of the complex. Lots of eateries, services and businesses surrounded it. On a side note the restrooms were pretty clean too.

Heard it turns more into an adult playground at night with the grass stage and eateries, but during the day the kids rule. Very cool play area that we will visit again and thanks to Zappos for revitalizing the Downtown area!

I am a mom of a 2 year old and a 1 year old. We came here for Mother's Day. LOVED it. Contained play area for kids while you can also eat and then play. This is perfect for family with young kids. 

The only thing about this place is elevator is not easily accessible for wheelchair and strollers. They only have one to get upstairs. 

I especially loved the Lego blocks and the blue foam blocks for the kids to play with.

How many places can you enjoy a drink (wine, beer or cocktail) outdoors in Vegas while watching your kid entertain him/herself for hours? I can't think of many, and none as cool as DCP--although it's really more of a modern outdoor mall than a "park." Cool place for a casual me.et up too, as there are a bunch of fun places to eat and shops/mini galleries to check out without a high "commitment" factor.
Food wise, I think the most notable spots are Cheffini's creative hot dogs, Stacey Dougan's Vegan to-go (second floor) and The Perch, where you can enjoy a flatbread or share plate with a nice view. It's just a little grown-uppy. Bin 702 is also cool for a glass of wine and a bar bite. 
They have a program of performances and activities on the stage/lawn area.

I really luv Downtown Vegas. This is a great new addition to the nearby area of downtown. Its very artsy and creative. The idea of large shipping containers into local businesses is very kewl. I like the fact that they enforce security and it is kept safe a very clean. After hours children are not allowed into the park and its a great adult playground. You can grab a drink sit and relax on any multiple of comfy seating area or you can have your own picnic in the mini park area while listening to a local evening band. Its great to cuddle up and relax with friends or someone special ...

This place is pretty cool! I would be more in the range of 3.5 stars, but unfortunately the bathrooms kind of knock it down to 3 rather than bumping it up to 4.

While walking around the Fremont area last Saturday night (I had never been and was visiting local friends), we decided to head down to Container Park for food since there's a variety of places. There weren't really as many options as I was expecting - the whole place was smaller than I had imagined based on the descriptions my friends gave on the car ride to downtown, but I'm still really glad we went.

A couple friends got hot dogs and one other and myself went to Big Ern's BBQ (which I'll review separately). Luckily, it was around 10:30pm and we were able to get in just before the restaurants closed at 11.

I'd like to come back sometime earlier in the evening, since a lot of things were closed (like the candy store, that bummed me out a lot!). But the toy store was great and the whole thing was pretty cute, from the all-ages treehouse that we heard a few slightly drunk adults playing around in to the little stage which would be great for small concerts.

I'll walk to a nearby hotel or casino though for the bathroom. I only needed to wash my hands of sticky BBQ sauce, but it was reminiscent of like a public park bathroom which, while clean, contrasted with the cool, hip, stylish aesthetic of the shipping-container-building-material-of-the-future-vibe right outside.

Even my 17 year old thought this was a cool and fun place to spend a little time.  If you are looking for a place in Vegas where your kids can do some running around and their parents can grab a bite or a beverage this is a great spot.  Like the sign says "no frowny faces allowed".   The play areas feature state of the art play equipment and creative sculptural building blocks.  This is NOT your average kids park.  Definitely worth a visit during the day time.

2016 Yelp 100 Review Challenge -     36/100

A great spot in Downtown Las Vegas to bring the little kids and big kids (adults)! It's a one stop eat with a variety of foodie spots, boutiques & shops to choose from. 

We always hit up Pinches Tacos, Chillspot by SasaSweets - for the shave ice and pops, & the Kettlecorn shop for that fresh made lemonade. There are a lot of tables and chairs to eat & lounge outside. 

There's a playground with a bad ass slide and a fake grass play area for kids with a stage for live music, a few couches, benches and blocks for the kids to build their own creations. 

When you're inside the shops (some are very tiny -- fits 5 customers at most) you can't tell that it's built from shipping containers. Very creative and innovative. 

There's still a lot of restaurants here we have yet to try and look forward to enjoying. 

** Note: I hope they add a misting system throughout the park for the hot summer months. There's a few near the stage, but nothing around the tables outside of restaurants. 

TIP: At 9pm, they kick out the under 21 crowd (even if they're with their parents) and card everyone who wants to stay.

I really wanted to love this place, especially because I went to Life is Beautiful festival and it looked so promising! It's a bit of a disappointment, to me at least.

To me, Downtown has ways been a place for me to go and mingle with people of my own age group. Somewhere I can walk around having a beer and feeling comfortable. For me, this space has been invaded! The big playground that is smack dab in the middle or this "park" completely ruined it for me. Children have taken over this place and that did it for me. There only a couple of good establishments here. There could have been so much more here.

Neat concept of using old shipping containers as building materials.  There is a good variety of shops but nothing really to our taste.  Go at night so that you can experience the giant mantis is all it's fiery glory.

I'd heard about this place from a few people and seen it in Sunset Magazine a few years ago, so I decided it was worth venture off the Strip to check it out.   The concept behind it is really cool.  Old shipping containers have been repurposed into an amazing urban playground of shops, restaurants and offices by the guy who founded (or owns, or is the CEO or something) of Zappos.

I had several delicious bites and drinks at various spots in the complex and people watched for a couple of hours one afternoon. They also have a playground and such for small children with treehouses and all sorts of stuff. It was pretty cool.  

I would really like to see this concept start popping up in other cities. It is fun, seems like a green way to build and brings a great energy to the area.

Nice to be at a place in Vegas that isn't packed with tourist and full of local shops (overpriced but that's to be expected) You have to try the Mexican eatery's carne asada french fries! It's the bomb and also the halo-halo at the ice cream place. They are kid friendly and my daughter enjoys playing around with the kids. I like that the play area is gated and has 2-3 employees watching around. I wish they have more stores though and that they would expand.

This place has such good vibes, good food, and good music! I've been here multiple times and the experience is the same. It never disappoints!

Container Park has a wide variety of ever changing retail and culinary fronts. Although surprisingly, most of the food places have stayed and become staples. The tree playground, blocks and light up game are showing major signs of wear and tear. 

Some of the stores can be interesting, but don't count on them sticking around for too long- if you like something you see, buy it now or grab a card to contact them in the future. 

They show movies on the astroturf during the summer, there's also live music too. You MUST try Simply Pure by Stacy Dugan! And Pinches Tacos for their margaritas and elotes.

Cool concept for an outdoor restaurant and shopping experience!   The containers serve as the framework for this outside consumer area that looks more like functional art.  Located in downtown Vegas, this container park is a trendy treasure that is a refreshing experience outside of the Vegas strip and is worth visiting whether you are a tourist or local.
